The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede, they have no money left to pay for laborers who are indispensible to them in sowing their land.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Céline S. A. has requested a loan of 100,000 F CFA which will allow her to farm about 1 hectare, growing some of the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cultivating 1 hectare in maize (corn) and hot peppers

loans.name: Alaine

texts.en: Alaine S., 19, is single with  children.  She has 1 year of experience in the Elei (traditional fabric printing) business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Alaine’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase printing boards, materials, and brushes for painting

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mrs. Vith T. lives in Srae Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She is facing some problems because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to apply for a loan buy these things. Her husband, Mr. Ket Suy, is a hairdresser. Mrs. Vith T. is 43 years old and the mother of two children, both of who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is seen here with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides to make her farm more productive.

loans.name: Aidah Namukasa Group

texts.en:
Aidah, a 49-year-old group leader of four other women, has seven children between 16 and 28 years of age, all attending school. She rents a one-room house with electricity and water access where she resides with her children. She also takes care of additional family members. Her greatest expenses in a month are rent and feeding her family

For the past 14 years, Aidah has sold second hand clothes from a market stall she rents, normally receiving about 20 customers a day working six days a week. She has been with MCDT for over four years now, having chosen them for their timely service, and is currently servicing her 12th loan. She is requesting her latest loan to increase her stock.

Aidah looks forward to expanding her business to improve her income.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Candelaria Marina

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria Marina G. M. es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Andina”, del barrio M.,  en el distrito de Platería, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 43 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su negocio es la artesanía (tejido a mano), su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra de lana para sus tejidos.  
Actualmente requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 04 cuotas, con el dinero podrá adquirir mas fibra de alpaca al por mayor y poder hilarlo para elaborar sus tejidos tales como chompas, guantes, chullos, etc. es decir todo lo que le pidan sus clientes; su deseo es comprarse un carrito para transportar sus tejidos a las diferentes ferias de la región.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candelaria Marina G. M. is a member of the Banco Comunal "Flor Andina" in the M. neighborhood, Plateria district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 43 years old, single and has no children. She completed middle school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuel Ramos for the past two years. She is an artisan knitter and her first loan was for 300 new soles which she used to purchase wool for her knits. She now needs a loan of 1000 new soles which she will pay back in four payments. These funds will be used to acquire additional alpaca fiber at wholesale which she will spin into yarn in order to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc., in other words, whatever her customers require. Her wish is to purchase a small cart to transport her knits to the various regional fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase alpaca fiber to knit sweaters, mittens, caps, etc.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M. is a 50-year-old widow and the mother of five children.  She has two daughters who have graduated from college, two children who are still in college, and another child that is no longer in school.  Before she joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) she sold various snack foods.  The proceeds from previous loans she received were used to open up her store.  

She is now applying for another loan to buy assorted groceries, which she believes will help her both sustain and expand her business.  Indeed, she wants to expand her store in the future in order to generate additional income so that she can finance her two college students' studies.  She feels that, by expanding her inventory, she will maintain her loyal customers and attract new customers.  Finally, she explains that her membership in ASHI has had a positive impact on her life and her entire family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her store by purchasing additional foods

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Fatima R. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee ella misma en su establecimiento con el propósito de salir adelante en su vida.

Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y así suplir sus estantes para atender a sus clientes en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the town of Chinandega, Mrs. Fatima R. owns a local store as her goal is to get ahead in life.

Presently she needs to invest in her business and for that reason she has approached Ceprodel to benefit from a loan in order to buy products for her local store and thus supply the shelves so she can serve her clients properly in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Atsoupi Julienne

texts.fr: Cette femme est une dame très dynamique qui travaille dur pour aider son époux qui est un enseignant  dans les charges du foyer. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de pagnes, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de bijoux. Elle s’approvisionne en pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et en bijoux au BENIN. Elle est très sympathique et accueillante avec ses clients. Mais elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock. Elle s’adresse alors à WAGES pour solliciter un crédit avec lequel elle pourra acheter 20 pièces de pagnes et 6 douzaines de bijoux.
texts.en:
This is a very energetic woman who works hard to help her husband, a teacher, with the family expenses. Her business consists in selling pagnes (colorful African cloth), to which she added the sale of jewelry. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé for the pagnes, and in Benin for the jewels. She's very kind and friendly with her customers, but she's currently faced with a depleted stock. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, that will enable her to buy 20 pieces of pagnes and six dozen jewels.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes and jewelry

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Marié sans enfant, Monsieur Youssouf S. a  25 ans et vit  avec sa femme dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni(troisième région du Mali)
Pour des raisons sociales (la pauvreté extrême de ses parents), Monsieur Youssouf S. décida d’abandonner l’école (à l'âge de 15 ans) pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus afin  d’aider ses parents à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.
Après plusieurs années de commerce tout azimut, il  décide finalement de s’installer dans la vente d’articles  divers de boutique dans son quartier. Avec ses 4 années d’expériences,  Youssouf S. maîtrise bien son activité.
Afin d’étoffer son fonds de commerce, il décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte acheter divers articles de boutique à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectuer sa vente dans sa boutique sise à Massablacoura à une clientèle riche et variée.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Youssouf S. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui servira à  agrandir sa boutique  et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Married and having no children, Mr. Youssouf S. is 24 years old and lives with his wife in the Massablacoura district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For societal reasons (his parents' extreme poverty), he decided to drop out of school (at age 15) to earn an income in order to help his parents provide for the family. After several years of all kinds of commerce, he decided in the end to get settled in selling various shop goods in his district. With his four years of experience, he has a good command of his business. To expand his working capital, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and is on his first individual loan. He intends to buy various shop goods in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. And he'll make his sales to a rich and varied customer base out of his shop located in Massablacoura. With this loan, he hopes to realize a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA for expanding his shop and for meeting the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is married and the mother of three children. She is 41years old and currently living with her family. She is a very hard working woman and committed to her work. She prepares and sells doughnuts in her neighborhood. They are prepared from flour; her doughnuts are mostly purchased by the school children and she sometimes sells the rest through hawking. Georgina treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She asks for this loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc. to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul O. is 40 years old. He is married and has 5 children. He sells sarongs of various colours in the market. He is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea M., 36 (pictured with her husband), and her husband, Mr. Sina Noun, 39, live along National Road Number One about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2004 and have a young son.

Sophea has been a tailor for 8 years. In addition to her tailoring business, she sells second-hand clothes. Her husband has been a security guard for many years. She is applying for her first loan of $ 1,200 to purchase silk fabrics for her tailoring business and second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabrics for her tailoring business and second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is forty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Gladys lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Gladys supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es: Cecilio es casado con la Sra. Teresa, tienen cuatro  hijos de 8, 10, 12  y 14 años respectivamente. Poseen un bien inmueble propio. Cecilio se dedica a prestar sus servicios  como maestro albañil.   La conyugue vende desayunos en su carrito ambulante.  Ambos cuentan con muchos años de experiencia en cada uno de sus rubros. La competencia es alta, pero la antigüedad, experiencia, calidad,  rapidez e higiene impuesta en cada uno de sus rubros, les ha permitido ser requeridos constantemente por los servicios que prestan. El destino del crédito es para mejorar la vivienda que poseen, efectuado algunas mejoras tercer préstamo  al que acceden, con excelente comportamiento de pago demostrado en sus créditos anteriores. No tienen pasivos en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Cecilio is married to his wife Teresa, and they have 4 children, ages 8, 10, 12 and 14. They own a nice home. Cecilio works as a builder. His wife sells breakfasts from a cart. They both have many years of experiences in their careers. Competition is fierce, but the years, experience, quality, speed and cleanliness apparent in their work has led them to be called on constantly for their services. The purpose of this loan is to improve their home. Some improvements have already been made. This is their third loan, and they have demonstrated their commitment to repaying these loans. They do not have any debts in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improve and expand their house

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 48 years old and married with four children. For the last ten years, she has been selling beans, rice and other provisions. Bola hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more inventory. She would like to say "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Liduvina es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Liduvina tiene un restaurante polleria llamado Kevin Chicken, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 9 personas.
Liduvina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Liduvina son ampliar su negocio, tener una cadena de pollerias y brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liduvina is a member of the Violeta communal bank.

Liduvina is married, 38 years old, and has 2 children. Liduvina has a chicken restaurant called Kevin Chicken, in a rented location located in the center of the city. She works there every day with the help of 9 people.

Liduvina needs a loan of PEN 2000 which she will invest in buying rice and sugar.

Liduvina's dreams are to grow her business, to have a chain of chicken restaurants, and to give a good quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: José Catalino

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos varones de 18, 15 y 10 años de edad en el caserío Pasabar La Granja, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El trabaja durante todo el día como peón agrícola, pero esta ocupación no es estable, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de instalar hace tres años en su vivienda una pequeña bodega – tienda que es administrada por su mujer. Alli ofrece productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y bebidas a los vecinos del lugar.

Actualmente su bodega se encuentra desabastecida debido a la constante demanda de sus clientes. Por este motivo está solcitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de más productos y así ampliar su negocio.

El nos comenta que debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atraviesa no ha podido bridarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior: los dos hijos mayores trabajan para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a la economía familiar, mientras que el último estudia en un colegio de la zona.

Su más grande anhelo es hacer crecer su bodega y reunir los ingresos suficientes para brindarle a sus hijos la educación que necesitan para asegurarse estabilidad en el futuro.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their three sons, who are 18, 15 and 10 years old, in the Pasabar La Granja neighborhood of Olmos District, two hours north of the city of Chiclayo. During the day, he works as an agricultural laborer, but this is not steady work, so three years ago he decided he needed to open a small grocery store within his home, which his wife now runs. They offer their neighbors basic goods like rice, sugar and oil, as well as other dry goods and drinks. His store is currently depleted of merchandise because of his neighbors' constant high demand. This is why he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa: a loan of 1000 soles which he will use to buy more products and expand his business. He tells us that because of the difficult economic circumstances he faces, he hasn't been able to give his children the opportunity to pursue higher education. His two older children work to help support the family, while his youngest son is studying at a local school. His greatest dream is to expand his business and save up enough to provide his children with the education they need in order to to ensure a stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more basic goods to expand his store

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An S., 32, is a married man who works as a construction worker. He and his wife have been living in a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years.

They wake up every morning, drive their boat toward the middle of river, and then fish. Once they finish, they hurry to bring their fish to the market to sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect money after their buyers finish selling the fish.

Recently, they haven't been able to catch as many fish as before because some of their fishing equipment has been ruined. Therefore, An S. is applying for a loan to repair the old equipment and to also buy more equipment.

loans.use: To repair old fishing equipment and to buy more equipment

loans.name: Jesus Miguel

texts.es: Don Jesús Miguel es originario de la zona 4 del municipio de Totonicapan su principal actividad es la artesania en la elaboracion de sandalias para damas dicho oficio lo aprendio  de su querido padre hace mas de veinte años hoy se ve la necesida de remodelar un pequeño taller ya que ha planificado ampliar su taller para el dos mil diez, la cual necesita de mayor espacio para poder contar con tres operario con ello aumenta su produccion y mejor su nivel de vida y la de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jesús Miguel is originally from District 4 of the town of Totonicapan. He is a craftsman who manufactures women’s sandals. He learned this trade more than 20 years ago from his beloved father. He needs to remodel and enlarge his small workshop, and hopes to have the project completed by 2010. Jesús Miguel needs the additional space to make room for three more workers so that he can increase production and provide a better standard of living for his entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand his workshop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina  es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 14 años atrás del distrito  y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, estudiò primaria incompleta, es casada y tiene 6 hijos (2 de ellos están a su lado y 4 viven aparte). 
Cristina se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y adicionalmente cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes y un kiosco en la escuela de su distrito.Ella nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
En la actualidad solicitará un crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar mercadería de abarrotes como fideos, azúcar, arroz, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Tacna y poner una tienda. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Cristina has been a member of the “Tupac Amaru I” communal bank in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department, for the past 14 years. She is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children (2 live with her and 4 live separately). She completed some of primary school.

Cristina purchases and sells cattle and also has a grocery store and kiosk at the school in her district. She tells us that with her first loan with Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital. She is currently asking for a loan of 3000 PEN with which she will be able to purchase grocery merchandise such as pasta, sugar, rice, etc.

Her dream for the future is to have her house in Tacna and set up a store. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato tiene 54 años, vive con su esposa Lidia, que tiene 52 años, y con sus dos últimos hijos que son gemelos; Juber y Jhonny, ambos de 16 años. El resto de sus 6 hijos varones ya están casados y han formado sus propias familias.

Este jovial hombre se podría decir que es “multifuncional”, ya que tiene varios oficios, los cuales desempeña con mucha dedicación. Primero empezó con la agricultura, trabajo en el que hasta hoy ocupa gran parte de su tiempo, siembra papa, cebada y alverja, con las que obtiene buenas ganancias. Para estas labores le apoyan sus hijos gemelos, pero sólo cuando tienen tiempo porque ellos aun no terminan sus estudios. También se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros y cuyes y paralelamente realiza todo tipo de artesanías, entre alfombras, telares, chompas, etc. En esta actividad también ocupa bastante tiempo, porque le gusta y aprendió desde muy joven.
Desde entonces, esta actividad también le genera buenas ganancias y le gusta mucho, ya que hace hermosos telares de distintos colores y texturas.
Para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad y migrar de la zona donde vive para probar suerte en otras tierras donde tiene familiares, pero continuar con la agricultura.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago porque quiere pedir otros créditos para seguir adelante con todos sus sueños. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para dar el tratamiento adecuado a sus tierras, y también adquirirá más carneros y cuyes para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Fortunato is 54 years old and lives with his wife Lidia, age 52, and their youngest two sons, who are twins: Juber and Jhonny, both age 16. The rest of their sons are married and have their own families. This cheerful man can be described as "multi-functional", as he currently works in various trades and is very dedicated to each. He began in farming, which still occupies a large part of his time today, growing potatoes, barley, and peas, which turn a good profit. His twin sons help him with the farming, but only when they have time, since they are still in school. Fortunato also raises and sells rams and guinea pigs, and produces different types of textiles including carpets, weavings, sweaters, etc. This work also occupies a lot of his time, because he learned to create woven products when he was very young and likes the work. Since then, this work has also generated good income and he really enjoys making beautiful weavings that have distinctive colors and textures. In the future he plans to plant greater quantities and move away from where he currently lives to try his luck farming in a different region where he has relatives. This is his first loan from MFP and Fortunato is sure he will make each payment because he wants to qualify for future loans to continue progress toward his dreams. The money he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of manure and fertilizers to properly cultivate his crops. He will also acquire more rams and guinea pigs to continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Claudia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  Señora Claudia del Socorro M. C., Labora como Inspector en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y mano de obra, para construcción de una pared de su casa de habitación ya que esta estaba construida de tabla.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia del Socorro M. C. works as an inspector for the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. She is raising two school-age children. She is married, and she has worked with loans from Ceprodel for three years. During this period of time she has invested three loans in improving her house, which she has done thanks to the loans from Ceprodel. The loan she is requesting is to pay for construction materials like sand, cement, and labor costs to build a wall in her house because it was built from wood. Her objective is to give her children greater security and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Las Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO DE EMPRENDIMIENTO LAS DINAMICAS SE ENCUENTRA EN SU SEGUNDO CICLO DENTRO DE LA INSTITUCION, LAS SEÑORAS SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER MUY SOLIDARIAS ENTRE SI, CUANDO UNA PERSONA ESTA POR LLEGAR ATRASADA O TIENE PROBLEMAS ENTRE ELLAS HACEN LA CUOTA DE LA PERSONA QUE FALTA.

LA SRA. CELIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA VIVE EN CASA PROPIA Y REALIZA MUCHAS ACTIVIDADES, ES PEINADORA EN SU SALON ADEMAS DE SER PROMOTORA DE COSMETICOS, TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES A LOS QUE ESTA CRIANDO ACTUALMENTE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA PARA SU SALON.

LA SRA. RAQUEL SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y JUGUETES USADOS QUE VENDE EN LAS FERIAS QUE SE INSTALAN EN LOS DIFERENTES BARRIO DEL PLAN 3000, TIENE SU HIJO QUE VA A LA PRIMARIA, ELLA DESEA AHORRAR Y GENERAR MAS INGRESOS PARA BRINDARLE UNA MEJOR OPORTUNIDAD A SU HIJO, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA PAQUETES DE JUGUETES USADOS PARA PODER VENDER EN LAS DISTINTAS FERIAS. 

LA SRA. MARIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA DURANTE LA NOCHE, ELLA SACA AFUERA DE SU CASA MESAS Y SILLAS Y VENDE POLLO FRITO Y HAMBURGUESAS DESDE LAS 18:00 HASTA LAS 23:00, ELLA ESTA MUY CONTENTA CON LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE SE LE DA AL RECIBIRLA EN EL GRUPO, CON EL CREDITO COMPRARA PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD PARA PREPARAR SUS PLATOS Y PODER VENDERLOS.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y DINAMICAS QUE COMPRARAN MERCADERIA Y PODER ASI INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The “Las Dinámicas” communal bank is in its second loan cycle within the institution. The women are noted for being very supportive among themselves. When one of them is late with her payment or has a problem of some kind, the others pay for the person who is unable to. Celia is the group president. She is a single mother, lives in her own home, and is engaged in many activities: she’s a hairdresser in her beauty salon but she also sells cosmetics. She has two, minor children that she is raising. She will use the funds to buy beauty products for her salon. Raquel sells clothing and used toys in the various markets that are set up in various Plan 3000 neighborhoods. She has a son in elementary school. She wants to save up and generate higher income in order to offer her son better opportunities. She will use the funds to buy packages of used toys to sell in the various markets. María sells prepared meals at night. She sets up tables and chairs outside her house and sells fried chicken and hamburgers from 6pm until 11pm. She is very happy with the opportunity that she has been given by being accepted into the group. She will use the funds to buy ingredients for her dishes. All of the members are responsible, dynamic people that will buy merchandise in order to increase their working capital. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 51-year-old married man and has 4 children. He alone takes care of his family's expenses: household expenses, hospitality, schooling expenses etc. So he works hard to provide better living conditions for his children. He has owned a mini-market in his town since 1998 and has 20 years of experience in this occupation. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow US$ 1,100 to purchase additional inventory to fill his market with food products, dairy products, drinks, etc., to satisfy always the demand of his customers.

loans.use: purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother, raising her child by herself. She sells clothing at a bus station in the small town of Svalyava, Western Ukraine. Silvia has been in this business for six years. This business is the only source of income for her family.

Silvia would like to borrow 9,500 hryvnia (UAH) to increase her assortment. She hopes to increase sales and make additional income. Silvia is a very active person and has the desire to develop her business further.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 6 and 3, in Harhorin province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for five years. Her husband, Bathuu, is 32 years old and a herder. 

Currently, Tsevelmaa operates a clothing trading business at a local market called Manlai Tod. She has been operating her business since 2005, and has steadily expanded her business. She started renting an extra counter in 2009. Her business profit is high during the summer months, from June to September, but is low from March to May. Tsevelmaa has good communication skills and she is focused on the future. She is requesting a 3,200,000 tugrug (~ 2,251 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory for her business.

loans.name: Scorpion Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe SCORPION ( 7 femmes mariées  et une célibataire) ont en moyenne  38ans, 2 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités qui sont entre autres la vente de tasses, de tissus,  de poissons,  des boissons et  des médicaments.
KADIATOU C. est un membre du groupe qui s’est spécialisée dans l’achat et la vente de boissons non alcoolisées appelées   sucrerie. 
Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 12 casiers de boissons (sucrerie : Fanta Orange + Coca-Cola + Cocktail, Sprinte, etc.) 
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes au dépôt de Boisson à Sanoubougou dans la ville Sikasso. Les boissons sont revendues après les avoir mis au  frais, dans le quartier à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.750FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée en épargne pour des fins sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The eight members of the SCORPION group (seven married women and one unmarried) are on average 38 years old with two children, living for the most part in polygamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, one of the boroughs of Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. This is the first time they collaborate with the Soro Yorowaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs. They carry out several activities, among which the sale of cups, clothing fabric, fish, beverages and medication. Kadiatou C. is a group member who specialises in buying and selling soft drinks called “sucreries”. With her loan she will buy 12 cases of soft drinks (Fanta Orange, Coca-Cola, Cocktail, Sprite, etc.). She gets her supplies from wholesalers at the Sanoubougou drink depot in Sikasso. The drinks are resold after cooling to both men and women customers, for cash. She expects to achieve average monthly earnings of 12,750 FCFA of which part will be put into savings for social use and the remainder invested in her commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy non-alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Samkol's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four people who live in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province. Mrs. Nha S. is the group leader, selected by all the members who are each going to use their loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Nha S. is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family, and her husband, Mr. Sophea Nara Ten, is a motorbike taxi driver. Now she has a big problem because her house is too old to live in. So to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Nha S. is applying for a loan to fix her house. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is only two years old.

loans.use: To fix her house

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin T. is from the village of San Jose. He is 31 years old. Alvin is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Alvin plants and harvests rice to sell. Alvin has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 52000 PHP whenever he sells his harvested rice.

In 2006, Alvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alvin is requesting a new loan of 27000 PHP which will be used in the same way. This loan will be Alvin's eighth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Lun P., age 29, is married and resides with her husband and a five-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She produces fabric for an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  P. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a taxi trailer to transport larger groups of people.

loans.name: Kilapei Ole

texts.en:
Kilapei Ole K. is 37 years old. He is married to Naramat K. and is the father of three children who are going to school.

Kilapei is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET from a market awareness done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to spend to prepare his ten acres of land for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions and also a market is readily available as a local miller comes to buy the produce from the farms. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Kilapei dream is to do large scale farming and buy some farm equipment. 

He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To spend on ploughing, harrowing, seeding, fertilizing and planting his ten acres of maize.

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de SOPE MAME DIARRA fait partie du Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE. Il est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 04 femmes issues d'une même quartier. 

Elle fréquentent toutes le marché central de leur quartier pour mener des activités commerciales (vente de légumes, de poissons frais et/ou de denrées alimentaires)

Madame Faty D., debout à gauche de la photo, mise en médaillon en haut à gauche, est la responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants et a la charge d'une fille confiée par des proches. 

Elle est détentrice d'un stand au marché central de son quartier où elle vend des denrées alimentaires. Son nouveau prêt de 200.000 francs CFA lui permettra de renforcer sa marchandise (riz, sucre, huile végétale, tomate en conserve etc..

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "SOPE MAME DIARRA" is a member of the "Banc Villageois de NGUIDILE". It was created on December 14, 2008. He's composed of four women coming from the same neighborhood. They all sells products (vegetables, fresh fish, and / or food staples) at the central market in their neighborhood. Mrs. Faty D., standing on the left in the picture, and visible in the inset in the top left corner, is the one responsible for the solidarity group. She's 46 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She also has to support a girl entrusted to her by her family. She has a stall at the central market in her neighborhood, where she sells food products. Her new loan of XOF 200'000 will enable her to bolster her stock (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, etc.). Her goal is to help her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is 29 years old and a father of one. He owns a van which he uses for a transport business. He has engaged in the transport business for four years. He also runs a retail shop together with his wife. He is a member of Mwangaza group in Faulu Kenya, whose members are accountable for each member who takes out a loan. He previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES, which he used to buy a van together with his brother. He has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES to paint the vehicle, pay licenses, and replace the seats. He hopes to own at least three vans in the future so as to get more income.

loans.use: To paint the vehicle, pay licenses, and replace the seats.

loans.name: Maira Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra Maribel A. es socia del banco comunal Medio Ejido, vive por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su rica cultura, su centro histórico, su variada gastronomía, la belleza de su vegetación y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Señora. Mayra Maribel  tiene 37  años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y de 3 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es chofer profesional y labora manejando un camión en la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Mayra es oriunda de Zaruma y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca hace 2 años, decidido venir a esta ciudad para  cambiar de ambiente, se dedica a trabajar en su propio restaurante que  lo tiene hace 2 años, labora en él desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m., de lunes a sábado.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, el crédito anterior le  beneficio en su negocio y ahora  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres y  materiales para su negocio como ollas etc. Su meta es tener su casa propia en la ciudad de Cuenca.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra Maribel A. is a member of the Communal Bank “Medio Ejido”. She lives in the Las Orquídeas sector of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for its rich culture, its historical center, its various cuisines, its beautiful vegetation, and the warmth and friendliness of its people.

Sra. Mayra Maribel is 37 years old, married, and has two children (ages 18 and 3). Her oldest child attends high school in the city. Mayra’s husband works as a professional truck driver and travels around the city. They do not own a home, so they live in a rental property.

Doña Mayra is originally from Zaruma, but she has been living in the city of Cuenca for two years. She decided to move to this city for a change of scenery. Mayra works in her own restaurant that she started two years ago. She works from 7am to 8pm, Monday through Saturday.

Mayra is participating in her second loan cycle. Her previous loan was a great help to her business and she will use her new loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients and supplies, such as cooking pots. Her goal is to have her own house in the city of Cuenca.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & cooking utensils

loans.name: Twende Mbele Group

texts.fr:
Kabuo Tahirana Jeannine est présidente du groupe reconduit et réélu pour le nouveau cycle de crédit à diriger le groupe  Twende Mbele, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 16e cycle, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, tous  vont à l’école. Son mari est petit commerçant, il a une pharmacie installée à Butembo, ville commerciale située dans le territoire de Lubero à plus de 410 km de Goma.
Kabuo Tahirana Jeannine vend des souliers usagers dans le marché central de Virunga, elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre environs 50$ qu’elle a reçu de son mari. Pendant ce temps, elle vendait des beignets. Après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo du 16  au 17 février 2002 qui a détruit complètement toute l’économie et infrastructure de base de la ville de Goma dont elle fut victime, elle a décidé de changer l’activité pour vendre les souliers usagers.  Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Kabuo Tahirana jeannine souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 75 pairs de souliers usagers. Le grand défi de cette activité est que  l’écoulement de marchandise (achat de souliers) dépend de circulation de l’argent (revenu de la population). En outre la concurrence des souliers fabriqués en Ouganda/ Kampale perturbe le prix.
En outre,Kabuo Tahirana jeannine fait des petits métiers artisanaux, elle tisse des tapis pour augmenter ses revenus.
Dans le 10 ans, elle ambitionne devenir commerçante grossiste et non plus petite commerçante détaillante. Elle compte s’approvisionner à la source dans le grand centre commercial soit à Kampala ou soit à Butembo.
En plus, Kabuo Tahirana jeannine est locataire, elle aimerait acheter une parcelle et construire, étant donné que  son mari travaille loin d’elle, ceci lui permettra de d’amoindrir  les poids de la charge familiale. 
Kabuo Tahirana jeannine remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. 
Ce groupe Twende Mbele  est  composé de 14 membres  femmes dont 1 malade (cliente Matunda J.) et cliente  Kavira E. n'ont pas été visibles sur la photo du groupe. D’où 12 clients visibles sur la photo.
texts.en:
Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana is the president of the renewed and re-elected group for the new credit cycle that manages the Twende Mbele group. She has her hand raised in the photograph, she is a client of the sixteenth cycle, and she is 37 years old, married, and mother of 5 children all of whom attend school. Her husband has a small business, a pharmacy at Butembo, a commercial town situated in the Lubero territory which is over 410 kilometres from Goma Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana sells second hand shoes at the central market of Virunga,she set up her small business with her own money ,a sum of about 50$ that she received from her husband. At that time she was selling fritters. After the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano from the 16th to the 17th of February 2002 which completely destroyed the economy and the basic infrastructure of the town of Goma, and of which she was one of the victims, she decided to change her activity and sell second hand shoes. She has been doing this for 8 years. With the loan from the IMF Hekima, Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana hopes to increase her turnover by buying 75 pairs of used shoes .The main challenge of this activity is that the sale of merchandise (buying of shoes) depends on the availability of money (the revenue of the population).In addition the competition of shoes made in Uganda/Kampala disrupts the prices. Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana also practises small artisan activities, she weaves carpets to increase her income. In 10 years time, she hopes to become a wholesaler and no longer a small retailer. She aims to obtain her stock from the big commercial centre in either Kampala or Butembo. In addition, Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana is a tenant, she would like to buy a piece of land and build on it since her husband works a long way away from her, and this would allow her to reduce the burden of the family expenses. Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana is grateful to the IMF Hekima for the loans that she receives without any physical security ,for thanks to these loans she can manage to provide for her children. This Twende Mbele group is made up of 14 women members one of whom is ill (J. Matunda) and E. Kavira who are not on the group photograph, which is why there are only 12 clients on the photograph.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 75 pairs of used shoes

loans.name: Tenes Ole

texts.en:
Tenes has been in livestock farming for ten years. He is 37 years old, is married to Teeka Ene T., and they have three children.

Tenes was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy ten sheep and five goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

Tenes also wants to build rental houses on his piece of land in the future, and improve his living standard with the increased income.

loans.use: To buy ten sheep and five  goats to rear and sell later

loans.name: Qantati Group

texts.es:
“Qantati” que en Aymara, quiere decir amanecer, es el nombre que las señoras eligieron para su Asociación Comunal, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, uno de los centros focales más alejados en Pro Mujer El Alto. Este es su ciclo número quince, de los once integrantes diez son mujeres y uno es varón. 

La presidenta es la señora Sabina, ella  trabaja desde hace diez años en Pro Mujer, su primer crédito fue de $150.-, actualmente ha solicitado un crédito por Bs 3500.- y piensa invertirlo en la compra de condimentos como:  ajo, orégano, sibarita, aji.  Realiza las ventas en la Ciudad de La Paz en el mercado de la zona de Villa Fátima, todos los días, a las 12 del medio día. Dos señoras le ayudan en el negocio.

Con respecto a los negocios dentro de la asociación, son variados, entre ellos tenemos: comerciante de artículos variso, venta de ajos, venta de abarrotes, venta de carne de cordero, venta de ropa y cosméticos, carpintería, venta de cosméticos y calzados, restaurante, venta de edredones y sábanas, venta de artefactos electrodomésticos, venta de tennis y juegos de Internet – juegos en red.
texts.en:
"Qantati," which in Aymara means "dawn," is the name that the women chose for their communal association. It is part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltacion, one of the most remote focus centers in Pro Mujer El Alto. This is the group's 15th loan. Of the 11 members, 10 are women and one is a man.

The president is Sabina. She has worked for 10 years with Pro Mujer (Pro Woman); her first loan was for $150 - now she has requested a loan for Bs 3,500 - and she is planning to invest it in the purchase of spices such as garlic, oregano, gourmet (spices), and chili pepper. She sells in the city of La Paz, in the market and zone of Villa Fatima, every day, at 12 noon. Two women help her with the business.

With respect to the business (represented) in the association, they are varied. Among them, we have: Selling of various items, selling garlic, selling groceries, selling lamb meat, selling clothes and cosmetics, carpentry, selling cosmetics and shoes, a restaurant, selling quilts and sheets, selling electrical appliances, selling tennis and internet games - online games.

loans.use: Purchase spices: garlic, oregano, chili pepper

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Ha T. C. is 39 years old with two children who are in high school. She is a farmer. Every day, she takes care of rice, beans, and potatoes in paddies of 3,500 square meters. Besides, she makes rice cake when she has  free time. This activity helps her have more money to cover her family expenditures.

 Being a client of our credit program since 2003, she is always in a good repayment situation. Currently, she needs a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy rice as a raw material for making rice cake.

Yen T. N. is 40 years old with two children. One of them is attending college. She has a shop that sells electronic appliances in Xa market. Currently, she  wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to invest in her shop.

So T. N.  is 50 years old with three children who are grown. She has a small shop that sells soy milk and tofu. She wants to have a loan of 7,630,000 VND to buy bean as a raw material.
 
 Thanh T. N. is 41 years old with two children who are in high school. She is a farmer. Growing rice, corn, and vegetables in paddies of 3,700 square meters helps her have food for  family and daily income. She wants to have a loan of 5,886,000 VND to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy rice as material for making rice cake

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more pork and pig's feet

loans.name: Felicia Candelaria

texts.es:
Felicia es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con cinco hijos. La señora tiene grado de instrucción de secundaria incompleta.
Felicia tiene diferentes actividades como la venta de abarrotes, compra y venta de chuño y artesanía. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue S/.300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizo para comprar lanas para el tejido.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes 
Su único sueño  es que sus hijos sean profesionales y seguir adelante con su negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es que se encuentra en su pueblo y las facilidades del préstamo.
texts.en:
Felicia is a member of the San Salvador Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Capachica, Province and Department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children. Felicia did not complete her high school education.

Felicia engages in different activities such as selling groceries, buying and selling dried potatoes, and making crafts. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for ten years. The first loan she requested was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy wool for weaving.

Sra. Felicia is requesting a new loan in the amount of 2000 PEN to increase the capital for her grocery business. Her only dreams are for her children to become professionals and to move forward with her business. What she likes most about her Communal Bank are the people and the conveniences of the loan.

loans.use: Operating capital for her grocery business

loans.name: Eliap

texts.en:
Eliap I. is 38 years old. He is from Kakamega Town and has a wife, Gaundicia, and two children aged 15 and 10 years old.

Eliap has a business selling hardware items in the open air market in Kakamega. He is currently applying for his fifth loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy more hardware goods like scrap metal and tools to add to his stock. Since he is the sole breadwinner of his family, he will use the profits for the family’s upkeep and to pay school fees for his children.

His desire is to open a hardware shop and stop selling in the open air.

loans.use: To buy hardware goods to add to the stock.

loans.name: María Ana

texts.es: María Ana N. A. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, junto a sus dos hijos. María se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, así mismo comercializa granos básicos. Desde hace 5 años que ella posee este negocio, el cual esta ubicado en el mercado de Soyapango, en donde sus ventas son bastante estables. Con el deseo de mejorar y salir adelante María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir sus ventas y de esta forma percibir mayores ingresos. María es una señora muy responsable la cual ha trabajador muy duro durante toda su vida para contar con todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
María Ana N. A., 44, lives in San Salvador department with her two children.  She sells fruit and vegetables as well as basic grains.  She has had the business for five years.  It’s located in the Soyapango market where all her sales are quite stable.

Wishing to improve and get ahead, María is asking for a loan to stock her sales so as to earn higher income.  María is a very responsible woman who has worked hard her entire life in order to have all that is necessary to live.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marlene Alexandra

texts.es:
Marlene de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 6 años atrás emprendió su negocio con un pequeño capital. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio ubico en la parte delantera de su casa una papelería  (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”). Inicio el negocio porque su esposo se enfermo y no tenía como ayudar económicamente al hogar. En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo cuadernos, papelería, plumas etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiración para su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo artículos para su papelería pero al por mayor como cuadernos, juguetes, plumas. Uno de sus objetivos con el negocio es surtirlo con bastante mercadería y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Marlene, age 31, is a hard-working woman who began her business 6 years ago with a small amount of capital. She lives in an urban zone called Suburbio, and her stationery store is located in the front part of her house (in Ecuador they are called "bazars"). She started this business because her husband became ill and did not have a way of helping the household economically. She currently works from very early in the morning selling notebooks, stationery, quills, etc. She has many aspirations for her business, and for this reason she wants to use the loan to buy wholesale articles for her stationery store, such as: notebooks, toys, and quills. One of her goals with the business is to stock it with enough merchandise and to improve her home.

loans.use: stationery store

loans.name: Wilson Mwangi

texts.en:
Wilson has operated his motorcycle in Naivasha town for the last five years. He is 30 years old, and married to Annastacia Kanini. Together, they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to renew his PSV licence, buy two new helmets and service his motorcycle.

In the future, Wilson hopes to own a taxi.

loans.use: To renew his PSV licence, buy two new helmets and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Karen Margarita

texts.es: Karen Margarita es una joven de 25 años que trabajaba en un almacén y  quedó sin empleo,  teniendo que abandonar sus estudios universitarios, por eso decidió emprender su propio negocio como comerciante de ropa, productos de belleza y útiles escolares, cada producto de acuerdo a la temporada en que se encuentre. En esta oportunidad ha solicitado un crédito de capital de trabajo, para trabajar con más flexibilidad, conseguir buenos precios y sobre todo comprar de contado, pues con él comprará  útiles escolares a propósito de la temporada escolar que se avecina y su entorno, pues tiene muy cerca instituciones educativas que ya ingresan a clases después de unas largas vacaciones. Ella manifiesta que esta es la razón por la cual  su inversión será exitosa, pues es muy buena  la demanda de estudiantes de las mercancías que ella vende, entre útiles escolares, bisutería, lindos detalles para obsequios y estos productos le genera un margen  de ganancia de 25%. Su sueño es continuar estudiando a partir del aumento de sus ingresos generados por la venta variada de sus artículos y eso si por su disciplina y la aplicación de todo sus esfuerzos a esta actividad.  En la actualidad vive son su cónyuge  en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno y se prepara como empresaria, esposa y madre, para cuando vengan sus hijos brindarles las mejores condiciones de bienestar posible.
texts.en:
Karen Margarita, 25, is a young woman who used to work in a store but lost her job and had to abandon her university studies.  Because of this she decided to start her own business selling clothes, beauty products and school supplies, each product according to the season she was in.

On this occasion she has requested a loan for working capital to work with more flexibility, get good prices and above all to pay cash because with it she will buy school supplies precisely for the approaching new school term and taking advantage of her location which is very near schools which are about to reopen after long vacations.

She states that this is the reason why her investment will be successful because of the high demand from students for the merchandise she sells including school supplies, costume jewelry and lovely gift items.  These products generate a 25% profit margin.  

Her dream is that her profits, generated thanks to her work discipline and all her efforts in this activity, will allow her to continue with her studies.

She currently lives with her spouse in the San Juan Nepomuceno municipality and she is preparing herself to be a businesswoman, wife and mother so that when children come she will be able to provide them with the best conditions of wellbeing possible.

loans.use: Will buy school supplies: appointment books, notebooks, pencils, ball point pens, erasers and paper goods in general.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
John Richardson, Jr. said, “When it comes to the future, there are three kinds of people: those who let it happen, those who make it happen, and those who wonder what happened.” Definitely, our CCT* Community Partner Emily A. is one who falls among the second group. At 61, she makes her dreams happen. Emily reached only high school, but just like her fellow community partners, this simple educational background has not served as a major hindrance to her in becoming a good micro-entrepreneur. Emily is married to Jose; together, they brought up five children in Santa Clarissa, Tanza, Cavite.

Currently, Emily manages her own sari-sari (variety) store, as well as a computer shop. She has these businesses running a few steps from home, which makes it easier for her to keep an eye on their day-to-day operations. She does not hire any employees, managing to run both the shop and the store on her own. Monthly Emily earns around Php 11,280. 

In prudence Emily decided to borrow Php 20,000. She did so  primarily to help her grow her sari-sari store. She opted to purchase rice, assorted groceries, and soft drinks. Also, she plans to buy an additional computer for her computer shop and some computer software.

Emily takes it a personal challenge to keep going on with her business and unceasingly pray for its growth. Nevertheless, she knows that with the Lord by her side there is nothing to worry about. She intends to save her profits and invest in another business in preparation for the future of her family because for her, success is something you don’t simply wait for; you have to make it happen.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends their group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she has received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchasing rice and groceries for her store

loans.name: Christiana P.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Holy Rosary Primary School, based in Kenema city. This school was founded in September 1956 by the Catholic Mission to improve the education of female children. Teachers of the Holy Rosary Primary School have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan. 

This is the first loan that teachers of the Holy Rosary Primary School have sought from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 4,500,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be in a better position to buy or invest in items that their salaries alone cannot provide.

Christiana P. K. is the leader of the group. She is 54 years old. She was born in Baiima village. Christiana is a widow and has four children. She has been in the teaching profession for many years. She has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc. and bags of cement.

loans.use: To buy house-building materials such as iron, corrugated zinc and cement

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina M. is from the village of Mibando, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Josefina is married with three school-aged children. Josefina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods, candies and biscuits in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and add to working capital. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her second loan from HSPFI.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She is a merchant, selling juices. She runs a stall in her house where people come to buy all kind of fruit juices: banana, papaya, orange, cherry, passion fruit and others. She is a married woman and mother of three. Maria tells us that for her, the most difficult part has been to get established economically, also to start building her house.

Maria is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has been working at her business for about three years. She is very thankful to have received this loan from Esperanza because she will improve her business. She plans to save the profit and to build her house after God blesses her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok V., 41, is married to Sokea, 42, who is a housewife. Sok V. is good at making bamboo baskets to sell at the market place in Kompong Chhnang province. He takes walks sometimes through the village seeking bamboo and takes it home and then puts it into water for almost a week. After that he dries it in the sunshine for three days. Sok V. splits the bamboo into smaller pieces and after that, he starts making it into baskets. 

Sok V. would like to take his loan to buy wooden stairs to replace the broken staircase in his house. He dreams of having a degree for his children.

loans.use: To buy wooden stairs to replace the broken staircase in his house.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S., 39, is married and resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of about USD 1 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Mayita Marianela

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mayita, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 22, 19, 15 y 4 años los mismos que estudian en universidad, colegio y  kínder. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que además de atender muy bien el hogar realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo, el cual  que se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, el se desplaza por toda la ciudad y también hasta sitios alejados de la misma para llevar sus productos a sus clientes, todas las madrugadas se dirige en su motocicleta hasta el mercado de la ciudad a comprar los productos a mayoristas para luego salir a recorrer las calles con sus productos, nos cuenta lleva dedicado a esta actividad cerca de 15 años y que gracias a Dios le ha ido bien.

Este crédito para comprar frutas, legumbres y verduras. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 7 ciclos y le gusta porque así puede  de alguna forma ayudar con los gastos de su familia.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The “22 de Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feasts of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Mayita, 38, here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has four children who are 22, 19, 15 and 4 years old.  They go to the university, to high school and to kindergarten.  Her husband's a merchant.

She is a great housewife who, besides taking care of her home, is taking out this loan for her husband’s business which is fruit and vegetable sales.  He travels throughout the city and even to places far from it to take products to his customers.  Every dawn he rides his motorcycle to the city market to buy his products from wholesales to then traverse the streets with his goods.  He tells us that he’s been in this business for about 15 years and, thanks be to God, has done well.

The loan is to buy fruit, vegetables and legumes.  She’s been in the communal bank for 7 cycles and likes it because it’s a way for her to help with family expenses.  Her dream is to have a vegetable store.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 53 years old. Arsenio is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Arsenio owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling vegetables like cabbages, carrots, potatoes, squash & ginger in the local community. Arsenio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arsenio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Arsenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Arsenio is requesting a new loan of 26000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables like spices, carrots & potatoes. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Arsenio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like spices, carrots & potatoes.

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Lubinda

texts.es:
Lubinda es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene  02 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, dicha casa está ubicada en el caserío Chica Alto en el distrito de Tambogrande, departamento de  Piura. Lubinda  vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

Lubinda cuenta con negocio de bodega-bazar, el cual está ubicado en su domicilio, su negocio lo atiende personal y permanentemente, ella cuenta con un buen nivel de inventarios y la bodega es una de las más concurridas en el sector.

Lubinda está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, para que con este dinero pueda comprar mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera pueda contar con distintos productos en calidad, diseño y precio para que sus clientes puedan escoger. 

Lubinda es una clienta conocida por Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado su puntualidad y responsabilidad, ella cuenta con buenas referencias, por parte de las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona ,tranquila y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Lubinda is a 41 year old mother.  She is married and has two children under her care.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her children.  The house is in the Chica Alto village, in the Tambogrande district, Piura department.  Lubinda lives in the rural part of this district, but she does have electricity.

Lubinda has a general store-bazaar business, which is in her home.  She personally and continuously takes care of the business.  She has a good level of inventory in the store, and it is one of the most popular in the sector.

Lubinda is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to be able to buy merchandise for her business.  This way she will be able to have products that differ in quality, design and price.  This is so that her customers can choose.

Lubinda is a known client of Edpyme Alternativa.  She has demonstrated her punctuality and her responsibility.  She has good references from the people who know her.  They describe her as a calm and hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Carmen Agustina

texts.es:
El grupo el Carmen Agustina de 47 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora desde hace 13 años se dedica a la costura en general es decir realiza camisas, vestidos, pantalones, bléiser…etc. junto a su hermana. Ella inicio una máquina de coser actualmente  compro otra máquina de coser para zigzag y más industrial.
Ella con el crédito comprará telas, hilos, botones…etc. para seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen Agustina is 47 years old and she is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been doing general tailoring for the past 13 years. That is to say, she crafts shirts, dresses, pants, blazers, etc. together with her sister. She started out with one sewing machine but she purchased another one that sews in zigzag and has a more industrial capacity.

With her loan she will purchase more fabrics, threads, buttons, etc., to continue to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia G. vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio,  barrio que combina espacios productivos formales e informales, zonas comerciales, edificios, conjuntos residenciales, viviendas, supermercados, y principalmente es un lugar conocido en toda Colombia , porque muy cerca se encuentra uno de los escenario más importante de la ciudad y de Colombia: “El estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla” donde se juega el buen futbol profesional y es la sede  del Junior de Barranquilla,  equipo amado en la costa Norte de Colombia.  En este cálido y amable ambiente, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 21 años Alicia, quien se dedica a la venta de mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos como cosméticos, ropa y calzado principalmente.  Su negocio lo inició en el año 2010 pues trabaja como empleada de una empresa transportadora y haciendo  turnos nocturnos, se percató que podía atender un negocio simultáneamente por eso poco a poco ha construido su propia clientela, la cual gradualmente ha crecido. Sus principales clientes son empleados de empresas, trabajadores independientes a quienes les otorga créditos de acuerdo a sus posibilidades en plazos pactados. Su horario es variable  pero aproximadamente trabaja 6 horas diarias. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará productos que le ha solicitado su clientela y que rotan muy rápidamente, como cosméticos y ropa. Su meta es aumentar sus utilidades aplicando todo su esfuerzo e invirtiendo permanentemente en él y más aun  en este momento en el que cuenta con un capital de trabajo adicional producto de su credikiva.
texts.en: Alicia G. lives in the July 20 citadel, a neighborhood that combines formal and informal productive spaces, commercial zones, buildings, alongside residences, houses, supermarkets and it's mainly a place known in all of Colombia because nearby you can find one of the most important stages in the city and in Colombia: The Barranquilla Metropolitan Stadium where professional football is played and which is the headquarters of Barranquilla Junior, a team loved in the North Colombian coast. In this warm and friendly atmosphere, she lives with her husband and their two children who are 13 and 21 years old. Alicia is dedicated to selling merchandise through specialized product guides, such as cosmetics, clothing and footwear. She began her business in 2010 when she worked as an employee for a transportation company doing night shifts. She realized that she could manage a business simultaneously. For this, she has gradually built her own customer base, which has grown gradually. Her main customers are company employees, independent workers to whom she offers loans in accordance to their possibilities in agreed terms. Her hours are variable but she works approximately six hours a day. Her "crediKiva" is the first financing that she has made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy products that her customers have requested and that rotate very quickly, such as cosmetics and clothing. Her goal is to increase her profits by applying all of her effort and investing permanently in it and even now count on the additional working capital that is a product of crediKiva.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing in greater amounts.

loans.name: Leonor Del Rosario

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 23 años de edad, ella vive junto a su esposo y 2 hijos en el distrito de Mórrope en Lambayeque. Esta es una zona rural cuya principal actividad es la agricultura y ganadería. Leonor y su familia viven en una pequeña comunidad de aproximadamente 80 familias.

Leonor se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace 6 años. Pero también cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa en su propio domicilio. Leonor les vende prendas a los habitantes de su zona y cuenta con clientela fija que constantemente le hacen pedidos.

Leonor es una mujer  trabajadora y sacrificada a su familia., ella tiene muchos deseos de superación y desea invertir en ambos negocios. Este es el motivo que la ha llevado a solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con el cuál comprará prendas de vestir para su venta y alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus animales.

Leonor es una clienta antigua de nuestra institución y goza de un buen historial crediticio por su responsabilidad en la cancelación de sus pagos.
texts.en:
Leonor is 23 years old.  She lives together with her husband and two children in Mórrope district, in Lambayeque.  This is a rural area whose main business activity is farming and livestock raising.  Leonor and her family live in a small community of approximately 80 families.

Leonor has been raising and selling animals for six years.  However, she also has a business selling clothes from her home.  She sells the clothes to people in her area and has regular customers who are constantly making orders with her.

Leonor is a hard-working woman who makes sacrifices for her family.  She has a great desire to do well and would like to invest in both of her businesses.
