loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc T. H. was born in 1962. She has two children (a son and a girl). Her son is a carpenter and the girl is going to school. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice, they also raise 200 chickens. Her husband is disabled. Her life is difficult. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong. This is the first time she is participating in SEDA and tries to repay punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: To buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Noonkishu

texts.en:
Noonkishu N. is 32 years old. She is married to Leuto N. and is a mother of two school-aged children.

Noonkishu is a farmer, a job which she has been doing for the last six years. Her farm is in a productive area. Most of her customers are wholesalers from the city who come to buy the produce and then re-sell it to city residents.

She learned about KADET through an awareness session done by the KADET staff in her area. This will be her second loan. She is planning to buy a new species of potato called "sangi," which research has shown can do very well in the area and produce a higher yield. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to meet the demand for produce.

Her hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and have her own farm machinery.

Noonkishu is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To buy a new species of potato

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children who all attend school. She rents a house with no electricity but with piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Christine's husband works with the Kenya Port Authorities and he contributes to the upbringing of their children and to the provision of their family's needs. 

For the last six years, Christine has sold charcoal to hotels and to her neighboring communities. She experiences the major challenge of theft and seasonality. She decided to work with Yehu in order to get a loan and expand her business. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Christine wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal and pay for her business license. In the future, Christine hopes to have another branch and supply charcoal to a larger market.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal and pay for a business license.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is 40 years old and a mother of four.  To earn a living, she sells clothes.  She has been engaged in the business for five years.  She is also a dressmaker.  Rosalia, who is a widow, works hard to educate her children so that they have a brighter future.  She is a member of Mumbuni Wa Mundu group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loan.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES. to buy more clothes.  She dreams of opening a boutique in the future.  She describes herself as a hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora A. is from the village of Abu, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Leonora is married and has 12 children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like home-made rice cake in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng K., 47 years old, has been selected as the village bank president by its 15 members, who are located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will each use it to support their different purposes
.
Mrs. Kheng K. and her husband, Mr. Yeng Yi, are farmers who own 1 hectare of land that they use to cultivate rice for living. This couple has three children: Three are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is attending the local public school. 

In order to support the children who are just working in the garment factory, Mrs. Kheng K. decided to ask for a loan to pay for renting a house and food intake.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to pay for renting a house and food intake

loans.name: Paul Ole

texts.en:
Paul, 29 years old, has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last nine years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use it to buy more animals which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

Paul wants to diversify his sources of income, so he plans to open a retail shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy animals which he will rear and sell later at a profit

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the town of Banga. She is 59 years old. To make a living, Nena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nena has been engaged in farming for over 30 years.

Nena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is employed as a garment factory worker, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Laubene

texts.en:
Laubene was born in 1980. He is married with two children: the first one is 9 years old and the last one is 7 years old. Laubene is a businessman and his wife helps in the store. He has two years of experience in this business. The hours of his daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.

Laubene is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase additional products for his store. With this loan, Laubene will be able to sell a large quantities of products, which is the best way of earning more profits to be used for his family and for his business as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for sale

loans.name: Angela Mercedes

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Angela es parte del Banco Comunal hace ya seis años y en la actualidad se desempeña como fiscal de pagos del Banco. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y freto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 15 – 14 y 11 años, los mayores están en el colegio y el menor en la escuela. El marido tiene una fábrica de adoquines y además es albañil. Ella estudió ciencias en la educación en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí y obtuvo el título de licenciada y en la actualidad es profesora de una escuela.

Este crédito solicitado es para el negocio del esposo ya que es el negocio de la familia, el trabaja de lunes sábado desde las 8am hasta las 17h00 en la fabricación y venta de los adoquines, nos cuenta que les vende tanto a personas particulares como a las instituciones públicas que necesitan de ellos para arreglar calles y veredas. En las tardes la señora le ayuda mas que todo en lo que es venta y contabilidad de la pequeña empresa. Trabaja con dos personas a los que él les paga un sueldo semanal.

Este crédito es para comprar cemento y otros materiales necesarios para la fabricación de los adoquines. Su sueño es que el negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In Rocafuerte canton, the 'Mujeres Organizadas' (Organized Women) community bank meets every fortnight.  This place is known for the delicious sweets and desserts which its residents make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Angela has been a member of the community bank for six years.  She is currently the bank's collector of payments.  She is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged 15, 14 and 11.  Her oldest children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school.  Angela's husband has a paving stone factory and is also a construction worker.  Angela studied Education Sciences at Manabí Technical University and is currently a school teacher.

This loan is for her husband's business since it is a family business.  He works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 5.00pm, making and selling paving stones.  She tells us that he sells them to the general public as well as to public institutions who need them to repair streets and sidewalks.  In the afternoon, Angela helps her husband mostly with sales and the small business' accounts.  She works with two people to whom her husband pays a weekly wage.

This loan will be used to buy cement and other necessary materials for making paving stones.  Her dream is for the business to keep growing every day.

loans.use: To buy cement and other materials for making paving stones

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma S. is a married woman who lives in Purok 7, Brgy. Isio, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling fruit and vegetables and hog raising. Her husband Ernisto, who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are between five and 30 years old. 

Wilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Wilma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia G. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 46 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she is presently engaged in buying and selling goods for business. She buys and sells herbal medicines and other herbal products. She sells it to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for six years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more herbal products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nemesia from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family. 



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: used to purchase more herbal products to sell

loans.name: Karen Estela

texts.es:
Karen es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años, de estado civil soltera, la señorita en la actualidad sigue estudiando.

Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos desde hace 07 meses,  su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de tienda general.

Su nuevo crédito es de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en juguetes, y toda clase de muñecas para venderlos en navidad, y es ayudada por su mamá.

Su visión en terminar su carrera y tener un depósito de abarrotes.

Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la unión y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Karen is a member of the “3 de Mayo II” communal bank in Puno district, Puno province and department.  She is 19 years sold, single and still in school.

She has collaborated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 months.  Her initial loan was for 300 new soles that she used to invest in her general store.

Her new, 800 new sol, loan will be used to buy toys and all kinds of dolls to sell for Christmas.  Her mother helps her.

Her vision is to finish her career and to have a grocery warehouse.

What she enjoys about her communal bank is the unity and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: To buy toys, like dolls, to sell for Christmas.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en: Jehad is a 39-year-old married man from Gaza, who lives with his wife and three children. All of the children are in school. In 2008, Jehad opened his own computer store in which he sells new computers and fixes old computers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to buy new computers and laptops for his store, which will bring in more customers and increase his income. This will have his family living a better life.

loans.use: To buy new computers and laptops

loans.name: German

texts.es:
El Senor German M. C., habita en la ciudad de Esteli, actualmente soltero, 60 anos de edad, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura, con mas de 40 anos de experiencia.
Inicio en las actividades agricolas con ayuda de sus padres; hace unos 30 anos, comenzo en sociedad con un amigo que tenia mas experiencia en estas actividades, otro motivo que lo obligo a trabajar en sociedad, fue que no contaba con el capital suficiente como para trabajar por si mismo.
El Comenta que en aquellas epocas que el sembraba, este negocio era mucho mas rentable de lo que es ahora.
Anteriormente el trabajaba en el area de servicio de transporte, lo que le permitio recoger un poco de dinero y comezo a dedicarse a la siembra; al inicio hizo una mezcla de ambas actividades y le permitio independizarse, es decir ser dueno de su propio negocio.
Actualmente convina varias actividades como Comercializacion de Granos Basicos y Ganaderia.
Realizo este credito para Capital de Trabajo, para sembrar Tomate; espera obtener buenas ganancias para posteriormente mejorar sus condiciones de vida y le gustaria mejorar su negocio, buscar tecnologia para se mas eficiente y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y su finca.
Dentro de sus proyectos tambien esta abrir una pulperia, con precios justos.
texts.en:
German M. C. lives in the city of Esteli.  He is 60 years old, has two children, and is currently single.  He works as a farmer and has more than 40 years experience.

German started out in farming with his parents' help.  Thirty years ago he started working with a friend as his friend had more experience in this line of work.  Another reason that led him to work with his friend was that he didn't have enough capital to work alone.  German comments that back then this line of business was a lot more profitable than it is now.

German used to work providing transport services, which allowed him to make a little money, and he also started working in agriculture.  At first, he worked in both businesses and this allowed him to become independent, that is to say, he was able to become the owner of his own business.

German currently works in a number of other business activities such as selling basic grains and livestock farming.  He is requesting this loan to use as working capital for sowing tomatoes. He hopes to make good profits so that he can improve his standard of living and also improve his business, introducing technology that will make it more efficient.  He would like to improve his housing conditions and the condition of his farm.  German also plans to open a small grocery store with fair prices.

loans.use: To sow tomatoes

loans.name: Abdimalik's Group

texts.en:
Abdimalik A., age 45, is a member of this group. He is a resident of Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan, near Osh. He and his wife are bringing up four sons, the eldest of whom went to work in Russia. The younger three are students. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Abdimalik works as a driver and his wife sells children's clothing at market. With the money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase more clothes to offer for sale in order to increase the turnover of the business. In the near future, Abdimalik wants to finish the construction of the family's new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
– People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
– Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
– Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase children clothing

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a cafe business for the past six months, selling to her neighboring community members. Christine faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of commodities in the market. She hopes to expand her business and establish a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of the loan products.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida works hard to support her only child. Leonida is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leonida requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase raw materials. Leonida has been in this business for 10 years. The photo was taken after the center meeting and all food that she made was already sold out. 

In the future, Leonida would like to improve the way of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ayitévi

texts.fr: Monsieur Ayitévi a 34 ans. Il habite quartier Baguida. Il exerce comme activité la menuiserie aluminium. Il a commencé en 2008 et s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra. Il satisfait les clients dans un atelier à la devanture de sa maison. Il a 10 apprentis qui travaillent avec lui.  Il demande un crédit pour acheter une machine de coupe.
texts.en: Mr. Ayitévi is 34 years old. He lives in the Baguida neighborhood. He works as a aluminum furniture maker. He began this activity in 2008, and he buys his supplies in Accra, Ghana. His customers come to a workshop at the front of his house. He has 10 apprentices who work with him. Mr. Ayitévi is requesting a loan to buy a cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 46-year-old married man, living in Chtoura with his wife and three children. He opened a grocery store a year ago and he's improving it little by little. Jihad is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business capital by adding new detergents and perfumes. He is doing his best to improve and he believes that this loan will be his first step towards proving that. 

His clients are his neighbors and relatives. He suffers from competition that's why he wants to add new products and make his prices attractive to new customers. Jihad aims to improve and expand his business in the future and hopes to achieve that soon.

loans.use: To increase his working capital through adding new detergents and perfumes to his inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 55 year old mother 5 children, all adults. She is a resident and a farmer in Kitale Town Western Kenya where she has been doing mixed farming for over 20 years and producing maize, beans, and vegetables, which all go to the local market.

Mary has requested for a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva Partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the proceeds from the dairy will help her educate three of her children who are undertaking their post secondary education. She adds the income will also help in improving the family living standards.

Mary notes that their challenge in farming business is the poor market prices for the produce. She is however greatful to Juhudi for the services and remains optimistic about the business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cosme Damian

texts.es:
Cosme es un hombre soltero de 58 años, cuenta con su casa propia de material rústico que tiene agua y luz, se encuentra ubicada en la calle Jorge Chavez de la provinvia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como principal actividad el comercio, la agricultura y el turismo.  

Cosme se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras,  en el mercado de San Antonio que pertenece a su zona, con una experiencia de 10 años , es por eso que es muy conocida y tiene su propia clientela.  Lo que le permite a Cosme seguir incrementando sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

El préstamo que solicitó Cosme a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa especialmente su cocina  y así más adelante tener mayores ingresos y poder solventar sus gastos.

Cosme  es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más grande su  puesto en el mercado y construir cu casa de material noble (casa de ladrillo).
texts.en:
Cosme is a single, 58-year-old man. He has his own home made out of rustic materials that has water and electricity. It is located on Jorge Chavez street in the province of Chiclayo. The principal economic activities in this district are commerce, agriculture and tourism.

Cosme sells fruits and vegetables in the market of San Antonio, which is part of his zone. He has 10 years of experience in this field, for which reason he is very well known and has his own clientele. This allows Cosme to continue increasing his income in order to improve his quality of life.

Cosme has asked Edpyme Alternativa, via Captial Semilla, for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles. He will use it to improve the infrastructure of his house, especially his kitchen, so that later he will have greater income and be able to cover his costs.

Cosme is a man with many aspirations, one of which is that with his hard work and efforts he will be able to have a bigger stall in the market and will be able to build his house out of solid materials like brick.

loans.use: to improve the kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 61-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children who are still attending school. He has 28 years of experience working as a car mechanic. In 2008, he opened a small shop where he sells car oil and batteries. His products are designed for all types of cars. Over the years, this old man was able to develop his work and expand his business operation. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products at good prices. He hopes that with the new merchandise, he will meet his business needs and be in the requisition of his customers. In the future, he hopes to enlarge his shop and add a new service: selling car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gantugs

texts.en:
Mr. Gantugs is a 33-year-old stone worker. He lives with his wife, Ariunzaya, and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His eldest two children attend a local secondary school. His wife works at a rehabilitation center as a nurse. Gantugs is member of the Mongolian stone workers association. The association helps him to find job orders from clients. 

Last year, Gantugs took a loan from us and started his restoration project of his family house. The loan was repaid on time, but the project wasn’t finished yet. He is asking for an another loan to complete the restoration project. He is planning to buy necessary building materials such as cement, sand, insulation materials for the walls, roof, central heating system to make his house warm to withstand the Mongolian harsh winters. When the project is finished, the house will be much warmer and more efficient in use of coal for heating and emitting a much lesser amount of smoke to the air.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials to make his house warm to withstand the Mongolian harsh winters

loans.name: Jaime Andrés

texts.es:
Al quedarse desempleado, Jaime Andrés de 29 años de edad, decidió crear su propio negocio, un puesto de comidas rápidas ubicado en una zona residencial de Rionegro al oriente de Antioquia de donde es oriundo. 

En compañía de un amigo alquilaron el carrito de comidas el cual necesita de algunas adecuaciones, así mismo necesita comprar los insumos necesarios para iniciar y empezar a generar sus propios ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

En el futuro, Jaime Andrés sueña con tener su propio local en diferentes puntos del municipio, así como generar empleo.
texts.en:
When Jaime Andrés, 29, became unemployed, he decided to create a business of his own: a food stand located in the Rionegro residential area in east Antioquia which is where he’s from.

Together with a friend they rented a food cart which needs to have some adjustments made.  He also needs to buy the ingredients necessary to start generating his own income and improve his quality of life.

In the future, Jaime Andrés dreams with having his own locales in various parts of the municipality as well as with creating jobs.

loans.use: to buy some ingredients and make some adjustments to his food cart.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est agée de46 ans et est une femme célibataire. Elle vit avec sa mére et ses freres et soeurs. Elle exerce dans le commerce de produits alimentaire. Mais auparavant, elle se rendait dans lmes pays limitrophes pour s'approvisionner en produits vestimentaires et cosmétiques qu'elle plaçait aupres des clients qui payer au bout d'un mois. Les nombreuses dettes impayées l'ont obligé à arreter cette forme de commerce. Elle a alors implanté une petite boutique devant son domicile pour vendre des denrées alimentaires. Avec cette activités , elle fait difficilement face aux lourdees charges de nourriture, de santé et d'habillement de sa famille et d'elle meme. Ces difficultés l'a poussent à ouvrir un compte à l'IMCEC ou elle obtient deux prets de 300 000f et de 100 000f qu'elle rembourse entierment sans retards. Aujourd'hui, apres avoir constitue une épargne de 52 399, elle sollicite un autre pret de 200 000f pour renforcer son activité. Elle envisage avec ce pret d'acheter 10sacs d'oignopn, 10 sacs de choux, 05 sacs de piment, 03 cartons de tomate local, 2 sacs de savon et 2 sacs de sucre.Elle espere obtenir des benefices de ce stock qui l'aideront à améliorer l'alimentation de sa famille mais aussi à faire face aux dépenses de sante ét d'habillement. Son ambition est de construire une grande alimentation dans son domicile qui se trouve au bord de la route.
texts.en: The borrower is a 46-year old single woman. She lives with her mother, brother and sisters. She sells food products. In the past, she used to travel to the neighboring countries to stock up on clothing and cosmetics, which she sold on credit to clients who would pay her back within a month. Many unpaid debts have forced her to stop this business. She has opened a small shop in front of her home in order to sell foodstuffs. She has been struggling to provide for the hefty expenses of food, healthcare and clothing for herself and her family. These difficulties have led her to open an account with IMCEC, where she obtained two loans, in the amount of 300,000 francs and 100,000 francs, repaid fully without delays. Now, after having been able to put aside 52,399 francs, she is seeking another loan of 200,000 francs in order to bolster her business. She plans to buy 10 bags of onions, 10 bags of cabbage, five bags of peppers, three cartons of local tomatoes, two bags of soap and two bags of sugar. She hopes that expending her stock will increase her income, allowing her to improve the family’s nutrition, and also cover the expenses related to healthcare and clothing. Her goal is to build a big grocer store in her house, which is located on the side of a big road.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of onions, 10 bags of cabbage, five bags of peppers, three cartons of local tomatoes, two bags of soap and two bags of sugar

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La señora Reina trabaja como costurera en una fabrica de costura en la ciudad de La Paz y su esposo trabaja como albañil. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de 2 maquinas de costurar pues su deseo abrir su propio taller y de esta manera tener mayor libertad de acción y decisión para mejorar sus ingresos. Vive en anticretico en una casa la misma queda ubicada en la zona de 3 de mayo en la ciudad de La Paz; es casada y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Señora Reina works as a seamstress in a clothing factory in the city of La Paz.  Her husband works as a mason.  She is requesting a loan to purchase 2 sewing machines because she wants to open her own shop.  This way she will have more freedom to act and make decisions to increase her income. She lives in an anticretico house [a transaction where in exchange for housing the renter loans the owner money which is returned at the end of the contract] in the May 3rd district in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has one child.  This is her first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: purchase two sewing machines so that she can start her own seamstress business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is the mother of ten children between the ages of 30 and 6 years old. She has been actively farming in her home area of Litein for the last 28 years and currently employs one farmhand. Her farm produces milk which she supplies to the local Kokiche Cooling Plant and tea which goes to the local market.

Agnes has made a loan request for 62,400 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.She says the proceeds will boost her family's food security and make her farming more beneficial. She plans to construct a modern dairy unit. She notes lack of knowledge as her challenge and is happy that Juhudi Kilimo is currently carrying out training.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 30 years old and is married. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is taking good care of her 2 school-aged children. Selling ice candy and juices around the local community is Marife's small business. She has been doing this for 6 years already. She earns PHP 2,000 every month. 
To have access to financial services she joined GDMPC earlier this year. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase snack items to sell such as hot cakes (pancakes) and banana cue (bananas fried in hot oil, coated with sugar). Marife hopes to expand her business and to earn more income to provide for her daily needs - especially those of her growing kids.

loans.use: To purchase hot cakes, banana cue and other snack items to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Librada

texts.es:
La Señora Lidia está casada con el Señor Carlos son padres de 2 hijos menores de edad, están domiciliado en Ciudad del Este, tienen casa propia.
Ella realiza el servicio de transporte alternativo de Ciudad del Este a la Ciudad vecina de Foz do Yguazu, Brasil. Gracias a este trabajo ella puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de la casa y de sus hijos. Cuenta que este trabajo es muy sacrificado, puesto que es un oficio que necesita mucho esfuerzo físico y mental. Ella comenta que todo lo que hace es por sus hijos y también por su marido, pues quiere ayudarlo, aligerando un poco la carga de los gastos.
Ella solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de los vehículos que utiliza como medios de transporte. Esta muy agradecida con la Fundación, puesto que esta no es la primera vez que solicitan un crédito.
texts.en:
Lidia is married to Carlos, and they are the parents of 2 minor children.  They live in Ciudad del Este in their own home.  She has a business providing private transportation services from Ciudad del Este to the nearby city of Foz do Yguazu, Brazil.  Thanks to this work, she can obtain the income she needs to support her household.  She states that this job involves a lot of sacrifice, since it is a line of work that requires a lot of physical and mental effort.  She comments that everything she does is for her children, and also for her husband, since she wants to help them and lighten the burden of the household expenses.

She requests a loan to maintain the vehicles that she uses to provide transportation services.  She is very grateful to the Fundación, since this is not the first time that she has requested a loan.

loans.use: to maintain vehicles used to provide transportation services

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan: de 55 años de edad el tiene su venta de refacciones, el se dedica a esta actividad desde  hace varios años,el nos cuenta que esta contento porque le a ido bien en su negocio, desde que inicio su negocio a umentado su clientela y tiene la ilucion de poder crecer un poco mas por momento tiene a personas que le ayudan en la elavoracion de refacciones,ahora el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elavoracion de refacciones ya que sus ventas han aumentado y nececita mas capital para trabajar,el sueño de el es tener otro local y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 55 years old and has a business selling snacks.  He has been in this business for several years.  He tells us that he is happy because his business has done well.  Since he opened his business his number of customers has increased and he hopes to be able to grow the business further.  He currently has people who help him make his snacks.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy food products with which to make his snacks as his sales have increased and he needs more capital with which to work.  His dream is to have another sales location and to help his family.

loans.use: to buy food products for making snacks

loans.name: Mukendambola Group

texts.en:
Linus is the facilitator of the Mukendambola group. Linus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Linus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Linus takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Linus had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Linus was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Linus will educate his children, ensure food security and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of the Mukendambola group will each plant between 1/2 and 1 acre of maize.

 In the picture above, the Mukendambola facilitator stands on the far left with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 47 years old, and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Editha owns and operates a retail shop at home to earn a living. She sells various grocery products, livestock feeds, rice, and rice and corn bran to the local community. She has been doing this for seven years. Her husband also earns income working as a chainsaw operator, but the work is not permanent in nature. From all income sources, Editha is able to generate PHP 7,800 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase rice and rice bran to sell.

Editha has been a member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Editha hopes to expand and improve her business to gain more income. She plans to invest in agriculture as an alternative source of income.

loans.use: To purchase rice and rice bran to sell.

loans.name: Rudy Wilson

texts.es:
Rudy, es ganadero, vive con una tía y un hermano, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado, está soltero, su ocupación con la ganadería la inicio ha ce 10 años, a él le gusta mucho este trabajo, su ganado es lechero y también lo vende para destazo, les dedica el tiempo completo.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo porque tiene la oportunidad de comprarse otra vaca, para la que no dispone de efectivo, dicho préstamo le servirá para realizar la compra y beneficiarse con un miembro más en la ganadería.
Su aspiración es mejorar su hato ganadero, ser propietario de ganadería lechera para distribuir en la zona, ampliándose en el sector.
texts.en:
Rudy is a farmer and lives with an aunt and a brother.  He is single, raises cattle, and has been in livestock farming for ten years.  He very much enjoys his work.  The cattle he has are dairy cows but he also sells cattle for butchering, so he works on a full time basis.

He is currently in need of a loan because he has the opportunity buy another cow but does not have the money.  The loan will help him make the purchase  and benefit from the addition to his farm.

His goal is to increase his livestock and be the owner of a dairy farm for distribution in his area so he can expand in the sector.

loans.use: To buy a cow his stable.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a man who works in the fish factory. Dinara herself works as a nurse. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 10000 soms, the family started to cultivate agricultural products for making additional money to family budget. With the profits gained from selling agricultural products the couple was able to provide their children with a good education. They also purchased household appliances and improved their living conditions. Dinara applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest. In the future she dreams to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for collecting the harvest

loans.name: Silvia Anabella

texts.es: Silvia Anabella.de 41 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo tiene 4 hijos dos mayores de edad y dos menores,y estan estudiando su primaria. ella tiene una venta de telas para confeccion,vende en el mercado de su comunidad tres veses a la semana, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de telas ya que en esta epoca es cuando mas se vende,telas por mayor y tambien quiere inverti rn compra de huevos ya que recien empeso su venta de huvos,el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande donde axibir su mercaderia.y seguirles dando estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Silvia Anabella is 41 years old, married, and lives with her husband. They have 4 children, two of them grown and two of them still minors in primary school. She sells fabric for sewing in the market of her community three times a week. She is asking for this loan to buy the fabric since this time of year is when she sells the most fabric wholesale. She also wants to invest in buying eggs, as she recently starting selling eggs. Her dream is to have a bigger locale to show her merchandise and keep giving her children an education.

loans.use: to sell fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 42-year-old married woman from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business. She sells items like shampoo and soap, vinegar, and coffee. Mary Jane works hard to earn an income and support her family. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and soap. She hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and soap.

loans.name: Mawa B Group

texts.en:
Alice takes care of five children at home.  In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. She joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children, build a house and invest in business.

Alice is the facilitator of the Mawa B group. She is pictured in the photograph with her group members. Alice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mawa B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Amistad se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par” por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Diana, tiene 29 años de edad es madre soltera de una  niña de 5 años  de edad, la misma que estudia en escuela. Vive con su hija en su casa, pues con mucho esfuerzo pudo tener su casa propia.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y con esto ha podido salir adelante con su hija, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda de vestir.  Sale a recorrer tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora su hija está en la escuela, deja  sus productos a crédito y cobra  cada 8 días, su mercadería la va a comprar cada vez que necesita a Guayaquil ya que según el allá le sale más barato, lleva dos años en este negocio.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha dado el grupo.
 
Su sueño es que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The 'La Amistad' (Friendship) community bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta.  This city is known as 'Calceta la sin par' (Calceta, the city with no equal) because of the beauty of its women and because, so far as its residents are concerned, there is no more beautiful city in the world. 

Here we meet Diana.  She is 29 years old and a single mother.  She has a 5-year-old daughter who attends school.  She lives with her daughter in her own home.  With a lot of effort, she was able to acquire her own house.

Diana is a very good mother and housewife who sells all kinds of clothing.  This has enabled her and her daughter to get by in life.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from home.  Her customers come to her whenever they need to buy clothes.  She goes out three days a week: mainly in the mornings as this is when her daughter is in school.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment weekly.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs it because she says that it works out cheaper there.  She has been in this business for two years.

Diana will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing.  She has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles.  She is her group's president and she likes it because of the help that they have given the group.

Diana's dream is that her daughter will not want for anything.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Virgen De Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Virgen de Santa Inés” .Las integrantes agradecen la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación  Paraguaya, ya que las mismas tendrán nuevas oportunidades para emprender un mejor trabajo, colaborando con los ingreso de su hogar y así brindarle a sus hijos un mejor bienestar. El comité se encuentra en el Primer Ciclo con 12 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son  unidas responsables y solidarias las unas con las otras.
Rafaela es una de las miembros, ella nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de pollos, comenta que le va muy bien, ya que los pollos se han convertido en una alternativa ya que la carne está muy cara. Dice que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus cientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The committee is called “Virgen de Santa Inés.”  The members are grateful for the opportunity Fundación Paraguaya is providing since they will have new opportunities to undertake better work contributing to family income and thus providing their children with improved wellbeing.  The committee is in its first cycle and has 12 members.  Each has her own productive activity.  They are united, responsible and mutually supportive with one another.

Rafaela is one of the members.  She tells us that she sells chickens and comments that she does very well because chicken has turned into an alternative to meat which is very expensive.  She says that thanks to this work she’s been able to get ahead and help her family and to cover daily expenses.

She asks for the loan to buy chickens to stock up and meet customer demand.  She thanks the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity they are providing her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to resell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is 48 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with one child. Florencia used her last loan to buy daily use commodities to sell in her retail store. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: 6 De Junio 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE JUNIO 2” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Costura de chamarras y poleras, lentes por mayor, tienda de aceite, carpintería, carnicería, tejido de mantas.

La señora Amalia,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un taller de costura de deportivos que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en conjunto.
texts.en:
The “6 de Junio 2” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada focal center.  It has six members headed by a governing board led by Amalia, the President.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which we have: manufacturing jackets and t-shirts, selling eyeglasses at wholesale, an oil store, carpentry, butcher shop and blanket weaving.

Amalia indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for a year having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters.  She currently has a sewing shop where she manufactures athletic wear that she’s had for several years now.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her working capital.  She will buy fabric in La Ceja and once made will sell them in street markets.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that it’s the teamwork.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort  live  at Mbeam near Abura. She  sells secondhand ladies and children's wear. She has been selling secondhand clothes for 3 years now. Comfort is divorced and has 2 children.  As a single parent she uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees. Comfort need this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies and children's wear to sell. With the new profit Comfort plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more secondhand ladies and childrens wear to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 42-year-old man from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have scant access to credit.

Under the communist state, Ivan worked in a state-owned automobile parts factory in Sliven. When the state support ended for this factory, the company closed and Ivan was displaced. Ivan has been out of work for the majority of the last decade, as most heavy industry has closed down in Bulgaria. His plan is to become a taxi driver. He recently pooled enough money together from family and friends to partially purchase a used car. With this loan, he will be able to purchase it outright from its owner, paint it appropriately, and make several critical repairs. Ivan is eager to get his taxi business underway, so that he can work as much as he wants. He is married with several children and looks forward to “supporting them as I should.”

loans.use: Equipment and renovations to taxi.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas A. is a successful woman with interesting family roots. She is a granddaughter of the famous national hero – Mastura Avezova. Mastura Avezova is a first lady who took off the “burka” (a cloth covering a woman’s face) in the early years of 20th century in Tajikistan. She worked at the silk factory and attracted the other women to take off the burka and to become active member of the society. So her granddaughter Mukaddas A.  from childhood used to work, earn money and be independent woman. 
Last year she received a loan for her hairdressing salon. As a result this salon became very active and now four hairdressers work there. The last loan she received was for accessories and a sewing bench in her sewing shop. There are two dressmakers in her sewing shop. Last year she organized a national dresses and suits demonstration in honor of her grandmother. After this demonstration she doubled the number of her clients. Now she has a plan to organize such demonstrations periodically to increase the volume of her shop, to provide more workplaces and to develop local production.

loans.use: Materials for Spring Season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of her used handbag selling business

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Mrs. Roth K. S. is 47 years old. She is a commune officer. Her husband is a construction  worker. Their revenue is about $4.00 per day. They have 5 children, three of whom are still students and two of whom work at a garment factory. The father travels by public transportation to his job every day. But this is expensive for him and it takes a long time. This is why he needs a motor-bike, as he will be able to go to work easily, and save money as a result of this investment.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for her husband to travel to his work without taking public transportation.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada B. is a 39 year-old-mother of 3 children. She's a self-taught woman. Nada learned embroidery on her own five years ago and started her business one year later. She works from home in a village called Bayssour in Mount Lebanon.

Nada makes crochet sets and does embroidery work. To keep her business running, she currently needs $800 to produce 50 to 75 pieces. When she first started with Al Majmoua, she used to make a profit of $50. She now employs 5 free-lancers and can make up to $400 profit.

The current loan will help her buy fabrics, embroidery accessories, pearls, threads - all that is needed to produce her embroidery and crochet work. "My daughter is now learning the business. I am happy to know she will be able to grow on her own."

Nada is part of a group called 'Al Omara' which means the 'princes.' The group loan is a group of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that is encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment for women.

loans.use: Buy the needed material to produce the embroidery and crochet work

loans.name: Patricia Jann

texts.en: Patricia is 18 years old and is member of the group called Mujeres Inmigrantes de San Cristobal.  Very smart and disciplined, she learned to sew at the age of 14.  She makes pants, shirts, skirts, and baby’s clothes.  She sells her products in her house and in the school to the teachers and her schoolmates.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of raw materials in order to continue with the fabrication of clothes.  With profit earned from her business, she pays her school fees and helps her father bear the expenses of the family, since her mother is currently jobless.  Her father is a farmer, and money obtained from Patricia’s activity is the second source of income of the family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as buttons, cloth and zippers to continue producing clothes for her business

loans.name: Chut

texts.en: Mrs. Chut S., age 26, works in a garment factory, earning around $2.50 each day. Her husband grows and grinds crops and raises pigs, earning about $4/day. They have two children who are students and a dependent sister living with them. She requests a loan of $1000  to expand her livestock by adding 10 piglets and two cows to breed and resell.

loans.use: To expand her livestock by adding 10 piglets and two cows to breed and resell.

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.es:
Lidia is 35 and has 2 children; Rebecca is 46 and has 4 children, and Paula is 43 and has 3 children. Lidia, Rebecca and Paula have belonged to the Alondras communal bank for 9, 10 and 1 year, respectively. They say that in their communal bank they learned to save, be punctual and responsable and that the members of their bank are very good friends.

Lidia is a textile artisan and along with her children weave goods such as rugs, blankets, carpets and wall hangings. They sell their work in the Santa Clara market in Ayacucho and in addition, Lidia raises small animals.

Paula also does weavings, such as rugs and blankets, per her clients' requests, and she sells her work to an intermediary who takes them to Lima and Cuzco to sell. Additionally, Paula sells notions at her stand in the "12 de abril" market and ocasionally she travels to San Felipe on market day where she sells fruit, bread and notions.

Rebecca, on the other hand, sells groceries, vegetables and fruit on market day in Quinua and Julcamarca and also works in agriculture and raises small animals and cows.

They need loans which will be used to buy thread, wool, sugar, rice, pasta, bananas, papayas, oranges, carrots, cauliflower, lemons, shoe polish and batteries. Regarding savings, they mention that they will have some for an emergency and to increase their capital. Lidia, Rebeca and Paula's dreams are to increase their merchandise, have mO. capital, build a house and for their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lidia tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Rebeca tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, mientras que Paula tiene 43 años y 3 hijos. Lidia, Rebeca y Paula pertenecen al Banco Comunal Alondras, hace 9, 10 y 1 año respectivamente. Ellas mencionan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, a ser puntuales, responsables y que las socias en su banco son muy amigas.

Lidia es artesana textil, y junto a sus hijos realiza trabajos en telar como tapetes, frazadas, tapices, adornos para pared. Sus trabajos los vende en el Mercado Santa Clara de Ayacucho, además de la artesanía Lidia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.

Igualmente Paula realiza trabajos en telar, como tapices, frazadas, de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes y sus trabajos lo vende a intermediarios, que lo llevan a Lima y Cuzco para ser vendidos. Además de la artesanía, Paula vende mercería en un puesto del mercado “12 de abril” y esporádicamente viaja a la feria de San Felipe donde vende frutas, panes y mercería. Por otro lado Rebeca vende abarrotes, verduras y frutas en las ferias de Quinua y Julcamarca, y además se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores y vacuno.

Ellas necesitan préstamos que serán invertidos en la compra de hilos, lanas, tintes, azúcar, arroz, fideos, plátanos, papayas, naranjas, zanahorias, col, espinaca, limón, escobilla, vela, betún y pilas. Sobre sus ahorros, mencionan que son para alguna emergencia y para tener más capital.

Los sueños de Lidia, Rebeca y Paula son incrementar su mercadería, tener mas capital, construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase thread, wool, dye, sugar, rice, pasta, bananas, papayas, oranges, carrots, cauliflower, spinach, lemons, brushes, candles, shoe polish and batteries.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 42-year-old mother of four who is married to Flaminio G., an electrician. Both she and her husband have worked countless hours to buy the house which they live in. This house is in the city of San Lorenzo, where Agustina works in a general store she opened 10 years ago.

Now that two of her older children are living on their own, Agustina has been able to save some money and wants to expand her business. Her plan is to build a store of her own and increase it from a general store to a little supermarket. Today, Agustina is asking for a loan to increase the goods sold in her store to include food like flour, rice and sugar, along with some simple types of clothing. With this loan, she will be able to accelerate the process of opening a supermarket of her own.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and products for a general store, including flour, oil, rice, pasta, sugar and clothes such as shorts, blouses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Francisco Fernando

texts.es:
Mr. Francisco lives with his wife and three children in the Memorial Sandino projects. For the past eight years he has been driving a taxi that he bought with the severance pay he received after working many years as a salesman at the Oriental market. With the daily income generated by the taxi he covers the household expenses and helps with the purchases his wife makes at the market in order to supply the grocery store they own and run. Both incomes have allowed them to cover all the needs of the family. They presently want to finish the walls and be able to lock the house to make it safer. His plans are to continue improving their house, buy a new taxi and hire a driver as, due to his age, it is difficult for him to drive eight hours nonstop daily.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Francisco habita con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en el asentamiento Memorial Sandino. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a conducir un taxi que compró con su liquidación después de trabajar muchos años como vendedor en el mercado oriental. Con los ingresos que genera diariamente el taxi aporta en los gastos de la casa, además de apoyar con los mandados y compras que realiza su esposa en el mercado, con el objetivo de abastecer la pulpería con la que cuenta esta familia. Ambos ingresos les han permitido cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. En estos momentos, la necesidad es terminar de construir el muro de su vivienda, el cual pueda cerrar y así su vivienda esté segura. Los planes del señor es la de ir mejorando su vivienda, comprar un nuevo carro y contratar a un chofer que lo maneje, ya que debido a su edad, le cuesta mucho manejar 8 horas sin parar.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, iron, sand and stone.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru:
Zarif K. lives in Radki. He is 33 years old, has a community college degree and is married with 3 children. His family is large, noise and happy and Zarif loves his wife and children a lot. He works as a driver, at the moment driving a big 'Kamaz' make truck. He has been working as a driver for 8 years. The job is profitable and is the sole income that his family relies on. However, there are always mechanical problems and breakdowns that need repair and this is why Zarif is asking for a loan of $875. He will repay the loan in the course of 15 months. Having the loan will greatly help him and his family.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Кутбиддинов Зариф житель района Рдаки .Ему 33 года . он женат и имеет 3 детей. Образование средне специальное. По специальности он водитель.В данный момент Зариф работает шофером грузовогй автомашины Камаз. Работает уже 8 лет. Кроме того эта деятельность приносит доход , которым он обеспечивает семью. Семья у него большая, шумная и веселая, и его работа является единственным источником дохода его семьи.Он очень любит своих детей и свою жену.Но не смотря на это техника постоянно ломается и ее надо время от времени ремонтировать . Для этого ему нужны деньги и он хочет получить кредит в размере 875 длларов США. А погасит кредит Зариф в течении 15 месяцев. Эта помощь сильно выручит его и его семью.

loans.use: Mechnical repairs for a truck

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy costume jewelry for a small business.

loans.name: Sekou

texts.fr:
Mr. Sékou K., 31, comes from a little village in Togo, Nzérekoré. He is married and the father of one child. After carefully studying his surroundings, he opened a sales point for cassettes, DVDs, and televisions in Anagokomé in Lomé. It was a success since he has had good sales receipts there. He is thinking of opening a shop in a different location, and this is what is pushing him to request this first loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur K. Sékou est originaire d’un petit village du TOGO qui est Nzérekoré. Agé de 31 ans il est marié et père d’un enfant. Après une bonne étude de son milieu, il a implanté à Anagokomé à Lomé, un point de vente de cassettes, de DVD, et de télévision. Ce fut une réussite car il y fait de bonnes recettes. Il compte ouvrir un autre point de vente dans un autre milieu, c’est ce qui le pousse à demander ce premier crédit.

loans.use:
Purchase of cassettes and opening a sales point

Achat de cassettes et decréation point de service

loans.name: Indira Cyntia

texts.es:
Indira is a young, single mother. She is 24 years old and has a 3 year old son. They live in the La Primavera neighborhood with her family. Indira sells various merchandise such as shoes and clothing. She has 2 years experience with these sales, and started in light of the need to have greater income with whic to raise her son. She started with her own funds which is why there has not been much inventory or variety. She needs the loan for the purchase of women's shoes and clothing and as such increase and diversify her sales.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Indira es una joven madre soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, y un hijo de 3 años, habita en el Barrio La Primavera con su familia. Indira se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada como lo son zapatos y ropa, tiene 2 años de tener estas ventas, comenzó en vista a la necesidad de tener un ingreso con el que pudiera mantener a su hijo, empezó con fondos propios y es por eso que el inventario y la variedad no han sido muchas. Requiere del préstamo para la compra de zapatos y ropa de damas y así ampliar y diversificar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Mr Chen S. and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Sngoun, have five children. He fishes in Tonle Sap Lake in Spean Thnort Commune, Siem Reap Province, and grows rice with his wife. They work hard every day and the main family income is from growing rice that produces one crop per year. The season for rice is beginning and in order to increase the crop yield, he is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for plowing and laborers. Chen's wife is pictured because Chen is unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay for farmland plowing and laborers

loans.name: Ni Ketut Murni

texts.id: Walaupun sebagai seorang guru TK, Ketut Murni juga masih mempunyai waktu untuk memelihara babi. Ketut Murni tetap berusaha membantu suaminya, Gusti Made Dana,  yang bekerja sebagai seorang Sopir. Ketut Murni memelihara babi dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,-.  Ketut Murni membeli 4 bibit babi untuk dipelihara sebagai penggemukan. Ketut Murni memelihara babinya selama 6 bulan, dan laku terjual perekor dari harga Rp.800.000,- menjadi  Rp.1.000.000,- . Keuntungan yang diperoleh perekor sebanyak Rp. 50.000,- setelah dikurangi biaya pakan. Ketut Murni  memberi makan babinya 2x sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Selain memberi dedak padi dan juga dedak gandum juga diberi makan daun-daunan seperti daun pisang, daun talas dan batang pisang. Sebelum diberi makan babinya dimandikan dahulu sampai bersih dan kandangnya juga dibersihkan. Ketut Murni ikut dalam kelompok ternak babi yang bekerja sama dengan Dinari yang jangka waktunya selama 6 bulan dan akan melakukan pelunasan diakhir periode. Sekarang Ketut Murni sudah mempunyai 2 induk dengan 10 ekor anaknya. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Ketut Murni akan membangun sebuah kandang yang permanen, sehingga babinya bisa sehat dan bertumbuh dengan baik.
texts.en:
Although a kindergarten teacher, Ketut Murni still has time to raise pigs. Ketut Murni always helps her husband, Gusti Made Dana, who works as a driver. Ketut Murni raises pigs with an initial capital of Rp.1,000,000. (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-10,000.00). Ketut Murni bought 4 piglets to be fattened. Ketut Murni raise these piglets for 6 months, and could buy for Rp.800,000 and sell for Rp.1,000,000/pig. Profit is Rp. 50,000/pig after decucting feed cost. Ketut Murni feed her pigs 2x/day mornings and evenings. Besides feeding rice and wheat clippings, she also fed banana, talas leaves, and banana trunks. Before feeding she bathe the pigs until clean, and also clean the stall. Ketut Murni is member of a pig farmer group that works together with Dinari foundation, and will make payment at the end of the 6 months. Right now Ketut Murni already has 2 mother pigs and their 10 piglets. Her hope is from Dinari's loan, Ketut Murni could build a more permanent pig stall, so that her pigs would be healthier, and grow well.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a more permanent pig stall (Membuat kandang babi yang lebih permanen)

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
La señora María Juana es la fiscal del Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas II y vive en la calle José Castelli 813, distrito La Esperanza Alta, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa, pero se casó muy joven con Antonio M., con quien tiene 2 hijos que son mayores D. edad y ya se encuentran trabajando.
Su esposo le enseño a elaborar calzado y ahora ella trabaja junto a su esposo y además viaja a Trujillo para colocar el calzado en las tiendas.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles, el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas, compró material para calzado.
Con este crédito D. 1,500 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, piensa ampliar su taller porque le faltan algunos implementos.
Sueña con crear una empresa donD. pueda enseñar lo que sabe y así dar trabajo a muchas personas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Juana is the controller at the Community Bank Mujeres Valerosas and lives in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru. She finished high school but got married very young with Antonio M., they have 2 children who are grown ups and already working. Her husband taught her to manufacture shoes and now she works with her husband and they go to Trujillo to sell the shoes on retail stores. With her first loan of 300 soles paid in 4 quotes, she bought material for shoes. With the current loan of 1,500 soles that will be paid in 6 quotes, she wants to extend her shop because she is missing some instruments. She dreams to have a company where she can teach what she knows and give work to many people.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extend her shoe shop

loans.name: Korn

texts.en: Mr. Korn S. is a villager in Plouv Trey Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate vegetables to earn his living. In his plantation, he faces some problems because his field has infertile soil which affects his crop badly, and he does not have vegetable seeds to support his field. In order to deal with these problems, he decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers to support his field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Chan Yoen, is a cake seller. Mr. Korn S. is 57 years old and the father of three children, two of whom are farmers who help him while the youngest one is attending the local school. His wife is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers to support his field to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. has been selling used clothes for the last 10 years in the marketplace in her town of Accra, Ghana. She relies on the income she makes from her sales to pay her household's food and utility bills. Sarah is 36 years old, married and the mother of three children who are in school. She is applying for this loan to buy more clothing to sell to her customers. Her long-term goal is to save enough money to send her children to college. She is a member of a local organization know as the Israel Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and provide support to one another when it comes to repaying loans. Sarah does not sell on group meeting days, but we were able to take her picture during her group meeting. Sarah says she would be most grateful for your assistance

loans.use: To buy more clothing to resell

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos vive acompañando a su madre que está anciana. Desde muy pequeña tuvo inclinación en el cuidado y la protección de los  animales, pero jamás imaginó, que empujada por la necesidad tuviera que sacrificar a sus preciados cerditos como ella los llamaba de niña. Aproximadamente hace 8 años que viene dedicándose a comprar cerdos, los alimenta con los sobrantes de la papa de su cosecha, y en seguida con alimento especial, llamado purina que tiene un costo de 60 soles por saco, que le alcanza para tres cerdos por 20 días. Y una vez que están gordos los sacrifica los días miércoles o sábados de cada semana; para de ese modo llevar al mercado su carne los días de feria, jueves y domingos que sus clientes la esperan. Para Delia este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que por cada cerdo gana entre 100 y 150 soles, su única dificultad es que cuando los compra tiene que llevarlos cargados ella misma. Este es su tercer préstamo consecutivo con MPF, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará alimento para sus cerdos, Delia está muy agradecida con todos aquellos que le permiten acceder a este préstamo.
texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children, one of whom lives with her mother who is old. Since she was young, she had the inclination to care and protect animals. However, she never imagined that, pushed by necessity, she would have to sacrifice her precious little pigs, as she has called them since she was young. Approximately eight years ago, she became dedicated to purchasing pigs. She feeds them the leftovers from the potato harvest and, later, special food called purina that costs 60 soles per bag that feeds three pigs for 20 days. Once they're fat, she slaughters them on Wednesdays or Saturdays each week so that she can take the meat that her customers expect to the market on fair days, Thursdays and Sundays. For Delia, this business is very profitable since for every pig, she earns between 100 and 150 soles. Her only difficulty is when she has to carry the purchase herself. This is her third consecutive loan with MFP and, over all this time, she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she willl buy food for her pigs. Delia is very thankful to all of you who allow her to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for her pigs.

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance). Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est un regroupement de quatre femmes du quartier Darsalam de la ville de Koutiala(troisième région adminstrative de la république du Mali). Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 6 enfants. Elles mènent  comme activité principale la vente de bois de chauffe. Elles ont de l’expérience dans la vente de bois de chauffe car elles sont équipées de charrêtes, d’ânes  et  ont de conducteurs.
Dans le souci d’augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a de cela tout juste un mois. Ces femmes sont à leur premier  prêt. 
Le prêt  sera utilisé pour achéter du bois de chauffe dans les villages de Belesso, Sirakélé, Tiesso etc auprès des paysans.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent réaliser en moyenne 55 000 FCFA de bénéfice chacune.
