Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, et faire face aux charges courantes de la famille. Dans l’avenir, le groupe compte obtenir  un prêt élévé pour pouvoir se procurer d’un chargement de bois  de camion rémorque .
texts.en:
The group Danaya is composed of four women of the Darsalam district of the city of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are married mothers who average 40 years of age and six children. Their principal work involves selling firewood. They are experienced in it because they drive donkeys with carts. Concerned about expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso just a month ago. They are on their first loan, which will be used to buy firewood in the villages of Belesso, Sirakélé, Tiesso, etc. from small-scale farmers.

With this loan, they each intend to realize an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest and to address common family expenses. In the future, the group plans to obtain a larger loan to procure a trailer truck-load of firewood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
J. Rafoat is a 39 year old woman.  She is married with four children.  Since she has lived with her husband, she has worked in the business of buying and selling cattle and also breeding sheep.  

She walks through the farms and several settlements to buy cattle at the lowest price to be able to increase her profits.  She currently has 2 cows, a calf, and 4 sheep which she will fatten for some time to later sell them.  

With the loan she wants to buy calves and feed for his animals.  This will be her first loan with IMON International, and her evaluation shows she is qualified to receive the loan.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. 

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves and feed for animals

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es: Deisy tiene 26 años, vive con su hermana mayor en una casa arrendada. Desde hace un año trabaja en su propio negocio de venta de comida en un centro comercial de maderas, sus principales clientes son los trabajadores de este establecimiento. El trabajo de Deisy consiste en preparar desde muy temprano los alimentos que ha de vender durante el día. Ella se proyecta para el futuro, es por ello que desea tener un local propio, porque el que utiliza ahora es arrendado y ahora trabaja duro para poder adquirir su propio local. Es la segunda vez que Deisy tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos por lo que es considerada como una integrante muy responsable en su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar, con otra parte invertirá en la compra de tarjetas de telefonía, ya que notó recientemente la demanda de éstas, entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Deisy is 26 years old and she lives with her older sister in a rented house. For a year she has been working on her own business selling food in a specialst wood shopping center, and her main clients are the people that work there. Deisy's work consists of preparing the food that she must sell that day very early. She propells herself forward and this is why she would like to have her own store, as the one she uses now is rented and she is currently working very hard to be able to acquire her own store. It is the second time that Deisy will have had a loan with MFP, and she has demonstrated her punctuality with her payments, and for this reason she is considered to be a very responsible member of her communal bank. The money she has asked for will be invested in buying sacks of rice and sugar, and it will also be invested in buying phone cards as she has noticed the demand for these amongst her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food/Compra ingredientes para sus comidas

loans.name: Adetokunbo

texts.en: Adetokunbo F. is 29 years old and married without a child.  She sells sarongs.  Adetokunbo is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She hopes to expand her business. Adetokunbo says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Naumati

texts.en:
Naumati F., 32, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the pig-farming business. She sells to the general public five days per week.

She has had one previous loan with SPBD, a Kiva partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (about $104). SPBD loans are Naumati’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sack of cement, wires, timber nails and iron roofing for builing a proper shelter for the pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
“Don’t live a life full of regrets, make a move today, not tomorrow,” said Edna A., who runs a vending business selling native snacks that she cooks. She is 48 years old, and married to a carpenter named Gilberto. They have been blessed with three children: Jeradel, who is 24 years old and a college graduate; Adilbert, who is 22 years old, and presently in his second year of college; and Jerryson, 17 years old, and in his third year of high school. They live harmoniously and peacefully in Barangay Centro 3 of Angadanan, Isabela.

Edna loves to cook glutinous snacks like rice cakes. She sells her cooked products to wholesalers and she sells them retail in their village. She would like to develop her business and has therefore requested a loan from ASKI in the amount PHP3,000.00. She will use the loan to purchase all the ingredients and materials she needs to make her snacks.

Edna hopes to attain her goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: To purchase different ingredients

loans.name: Nafi

texts.fr: madame nafi D. est une femme divorcée qui a cinq enfants à charge;elle fait du commerce depuis 1985.elle est membre de la mutuelle depuis deux ans et a déja bénéficié de crédit;avec ce pret elle veut renforcer son stock de marchandises composé d'huile de palme;de miel ;de tissus et de chaussures!
texts.en:
Ms. Nafi D. is a divorced woman who has five children to support. She has been working in commerce since 1985. She has been a member of the mutuelle for two years and has already benefited from a loan. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock of merchandise composed of palm oil, honey, cloth, and shoes!

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster working capital

loans.name: Botir

texts.ru: Курбонов  Ботир – мужчина  1977  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет   2  детей.  После  того,  как  он  остался  без  работы  и  вернулся  из  Российской  Федерации,  он  решил  заняться  мелким  бизнесом.  Взяв  в  аренду  маленький  магазинчик  на  территории  колхозного  рынка  Джаббор-Расуловского  района,  он  занялся  торговлей  мелкими товарами. Вот уже более 7 лет они вместе с женой расширяют  свой  товарооборот.  Накопив  немного  денег  они  собираются  собственный  магазин  в  центре  района.  Кроме  нашей  организации,  в  осуществлении  бизнес-планов  им  помогают  их родители.
texts.en:
Born in 1971, Botir K. is married and has 2 children. After he lost his job and returned from the Russian Federation, Botir decided to start a small business. He leased a small store at an agricultural market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district and started selling merchandise. Together with his wife, Botir has been increasing his goods turnover for over 7 years. They plan to save enough money to open their own store in the district center. Besides our organization, their parents help Botir and his wife with their business-plan realization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of light bulbs

loans.name: Barkat Muhammad Siddique Group

texts.en:
Farhat parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (hard paper, gum) for her sweetmeat box making business.  
Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy garments to sell. 
Tayyaba baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. 

Barkat baji is a wife of M. S. who has lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband deals with both ladies & gents garments. He has a good number of customers because of his variety and quality. Barkat baji is a very supportive and kind lady. She helps her members when they need her. She is applying for a loan to buy garments to increase the profit of her husband’s business.


This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: “Barkat baji wears a white shawl in this picture”.

loans.use: To buy garments to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 40 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos que la apoyan en todo lo posible. Desde hace 3 años de dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso en un puesto del mercado de su localidad. Gracias a esta labor puede solventar los gastos y la educación de sus hijos, a quienes espera ver, más adelante, buenos profesionales. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede relacionarse con varias personas y sobre todo que cada día aprende más sobre el comercio y cómo mejorar sus ventas. Carmen considera que su negocio es rentable porque los precios de las prendas que vende son accesibles para todas las personas y para un futuro cercano le gustaría establecerse en un local estable. Este es su 6to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas confiables y responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa de segundo uso.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and a single mother. She lives with her 2 children who support her in every way possible. She has been selling second-hand clothing at a market stand in her area. Thanks to her work, she is able to cover the expenses and education of her children, who she hopes will be professionals in the future. What she likes about her job is that she can interact with a variety of people and above all, she learns more about business and how to improve her sales each day. Carmen considers her business to be profitable because the prices of the pieces of clothing that she sells are affordable for everyone. In the near future, she would like to establish herself in a stable site.

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she likes that her fellow members are trustworthy and responsible people. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more second-hand clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en: N. Margaret is a 40-year-old lady and the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is the mother of nine children as she cares for other orphans also in school. She has had a business selling agricultural produce for 10 year. She buys from the farmers in the villages and her main challenge is the scarcity of the farm produce as a result of a bad season. At the start, she had only one type but now has a variety to choose from and sell, hence making about 300,000/= profit per month. She is grateful for the loans and in the future, she plans to have enough so that she can supply her fellow workers. Margaret needs a loan to help increase her stock since this brings in more profits that help to pay school fees and upkeep of her family.

loans.use: To restock her business with more farm produce.

loans.name: La Reina 3 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the group coordinator of the L. Reina (the Queen) which is based in the slums of northern Santo Domingo, where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) is unreliable. She lives here with eight other individuals in a small home which she rents.

Her goal in taking this loan is to continue growing her business selling "ropa D. paca" (used clothing which comes in large containers from the United States) as well as shoes. She aims to use her augmented income to support her children as they go through school. Her long term dream is to own her own home, which will save her considerable money over paying rent. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: More clothing and shoes for selling

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia Carolina es socia del Bancomunal un Nuevo Día, Patricia Carolina es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos D. 18, 12 y 9 años, el mayor estudia en la Universidad y los menores están en la escuela. 
DesD. hace 3 años Patricia tiene su negocio D. venta D. ropa y otras cosas para niños, como juguetes. Ella tiene familia en los Estados Unidos que manda la mercadería para que ella pueda venderla, y ella también envía mercadería Peruana a los Estados Unidos para que su familia pueD. venderla allá. También tiene un minidepartemento que alquila. 
DesD. que comenzó en Finca ha cambiado para bien, porque pueD. invertir más. 
Patricia Elena necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para comprar mercadería que venD. como ropa.
Patricia Carolina sueña con tener su propio negocio D. mercadería Americana
texts.en:
Patricia Carolina is a member of the New Day Communal Bank. She is married, 40 years old, and has 3 children, ages 18, 12, and 9. The eldest studies in the University and the younger ones are in school.

For the last 3 years, Patricia has had a business selling children's clothes and other things such as toys. She has family members in the United States who send merchandise for her to sell, and she sends Peruvian merchandise to the U.S. for her family to sell there. Also, she has a tiny apartment that she rents out.

Since she began in Finca, things have changed for the better because she could invest more. Patricia Carolina dreams of having her own business to sell American merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE SUCH AS CLOTHES TO SELL

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde is happily married with 3 children and she is 35 years old. She sells medicines. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is requesting the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Primero D. Agosto” D. distrito D. Zepita, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 57 años D. edad,  estado civil Viuda, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la Av. panamericana en el distrito D. Zepita, ella no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. frutas.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar plátanos, naranjas, piñas, uvas, etc. Las compra en Juliaca  y Desaguadero y lo venD. en el mercado D. zepita.

Su mayor deseo es sacar profesionales a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las facilidades en los préstamos y las reuniones

loans.use: Para la compra de plátanos, naranjas, piñas, uvas,

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline  S. Cedeño es socia del Banco Comunal Mejía  ubicado en Portoviejo provincia de Manabí, ésta es una de las regiones más hermosas del Ecuador por sus playas y gastronomía.

Jaqueline anteriormente se dedicaba a preparar comida y dulces para fiestas pero como no siempre tenía trabajo incursionó en el comercio informal,  ahora ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de sabanas, pantalones, camisas, ropa en general, su trabajo lo realiza puerta a puerta visitando a sus clientes en sus domicilios y trabajos, toma el pedido y luego entrega la mercadería a crédito. 

El esposo de Jacqueline esta delicado de salud por lo que ella  es la encarga de llevar el sustento para su hogar,  cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos sobre  todo su hijo menor que trabaja en una cerrajería con su tío y con lo que gana aporta para los gastos del hogar y van  superando  los problemas económicos.

El crédito solicitado por Jacqueline es para comprar  ropa para damas, caballeros, niños, sábanas y otros productos para la época  navideña.
texts.en:
Jacqueline S. Cedeño is a member of the Mejía communal bank ,which is located in Portoviejo, Manabí province, which is one of Ecuador's most beautiful regions thanks to its beaches and gastronomy. Jacqueline used to work preparing meals and sweets for parties but, since work was never steady, she decided to enter the informal economy and now works selling clothing and bed linens door-to-door visiting her customers in their homes and work places. She takes their orders and then delivers the merchandise on credit. Jacqueline's husband is not well so household expenses are her sole responsibility. Her children, especially her youngest who works at a locksmith shop with his uncle, help. Together they are able to meet their household expenses and solve their economic problems. The loan Jacqueline is requesting will be used to buy clothing, bed linens and other products for the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children as well as bed linen sets for the holiday season.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao L., 29, resides in Battambong Province, Cambodia with his wife and three children. To make a living, he operates his motorbike as a taxi  everywhere in the town, earning an income of US $3 per day, while his wife sells sugar cane juice, bringing total family income to US $5 per day, which covers the basic household expenses. Mao and his family are seeking to improve their standard of living, and so he is requesting a loan of US $1000 to replace his old motorbike, which is in need of frequent repairs, with a new one to improve his current business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Since the death of her husband a long time ago, Rita D. faces life’s challenges brought about by poverty alone, working to enable her two children to survive. Now she is 55 years of age and still facing a lot of adversities in life that sometimes makes her weak. However, the thought of her children having low educational attainment and less opportunity to get a good employment enables her to regain strength to continue fighting and win the battle against poverty. Her eldest child is 31 years old and has an income from driving a tricycle (a motorcycle with a sidecar that is used as people’s means of transportation), which Rita bought using a previous loan; her younger child is 27 years old and a waiter.

Still, Rita wants to have her own business and help her children. She hopes that her business of fattening cattle (a cow can be sold for as much double its price after two to three years) will grow and becomes sustainable someday through loans she can obtain from ASHI with the support of its partner, Kiva. Rita knew that, because she is poor, her children have nothing to inherit when her life is over, but having a sustainable business for them to manage and continue will enable them to be more secure in their own lives.

loans.use: To purchase two cows to raise and sell

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deisy tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo (Andrés), de 10 años de edad, ellos tienen su casa propia.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comida, ya que desde muy joven ha sido muy  avocada a esta actividad, en la cual se ha se ha caracterizado por tener una buena sazón. Es por ello que decidió tener un negocio propio, pues necesitaba algo que ella pueda realizar desde su casa, porque tener un hijo en edad escolar necesita de mucha atención.
Por tal motivo, esta labor le gusta mucho porque prepara la cantidad exacta de porciones que le solicitan para posteriormente pasar a dejarlos a sus clientes.
Pero por otra parte, es muy sacrificado, pues sus clientes son muy exigentes y debe preparar cada plato con mucha dedicación. 
Para el futuro, Deisy quisiera tener mayor estabilidad con un restaurante donde atender mejor a la clientela.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, ella se considera una persona muy responsable, es por ello que se compromete con cancelar cada una de las cuotas a tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para preparar más platos, ya que su cantidad de clientes se ha incrementado y espera poder abastecer a todos.
texts.en:
Deisy is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and their 10-year-old son Andres. The have their own house.

For two years, Deisy has had a business selling food. She has been cooking from an early age and is noted for her good taste. It was for this reason that she started her own business. Also, she needed something she could do at home, because raising a school-aged child requires much attention.

She enjoys this work because she prepares the exact quantity of portions that were ordered, then delivers them to the clients. At the same time, it is difficult because the clients are very demanding so she must prepare each dish with real dedication. For the future, Deisy would like to have more stability with a restaurant where she could better serve her clients.

This is Deisy’s first loan with MFP. She is considered a very responsible person and she promises to make each payment on time. With the money from this loan, she will buy a larger quantity of ingredients to prepare more dishes. Her client base has expanded and she wants to satisfy them all.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie B. is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Josie owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling barbecued pork and chicken. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. Josie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
Marisa es una mujer de 40 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos: Luis de 19 y Melody  de 12 años.
Hace 6 años ella y su esposo decidieron dedicarse a la venta de tubos, pinturas y demás accesorios de ferretería. Para ello se ubicaron en un lugar céntrico y muy concurrido de la ciudad, ya que la visión de esta pareja era prosperar. A inicios sufrieron mucho, pues no les alcanzaba ni para el alquiler mensual del local, entonces su esposo empezó a ofrecer y revender a otras ferreterías sus productos a una mínima ganancia, jamás imaginó que esta modalidad los llevaría a la cúspide. 
Ahora Marisa ya no atiende su establecimiento, pues está más evocada a la facturación y al orden de los pedidos, inclusive a veces no se abastece, por ello cuentan con la ayuda de uno de sus sobrinos, preferentemente por las tardes cuando hay más clientes.
Para el futuro, Marisa anhela implementar otra sucursal porque este negocio es muy rentable, y de ese modo brindarles seguridad a sus hijos. 

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable como hasta ahora, además comenta su conformidad y comodidad en su banco comunal, ya que se lleva muy bien con todas sus compañeras. El dinero que ahora solicita es para incrementar con más productos a su ferretería, asegurándose tener reservas en su almacén.
texts.en:
Marisa is 40 years old and lives with her husband. They have two children, Luis, 19, and Melody, 12. Six years ago Marisa and her husband decided to start a hardware business. They located their shop in a central area of the city which is always busy. In the beginning they suffered a lot, not earning enough to even pay their rent. Marisa's husband began to offer and resell their products to other hardware stores for a minimal profit, never imagining that this model would actually be so successful. Now, Marisa doesn't work in the shop, as she is busy handling the billing and processing of the orders they receive. Sometimes it's so busy she counts on the help of one of her nephews, usually in the afternoons when there are more customers. For the future, Marisa would like to set up another location. Their model works well and she would like to build the business and help bring more financial security to her children. This is the 9th loan she has received from MFP and she's always made her payments on time. She also likes the comfort and sense of community she gets from the communal bank, and she gets along well with other members. The money from this loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for their hardware business, making sure they have enough inventory in their shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her hardware business, making sure there is enough inventory in the store

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 58 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Máximo (58). Ellos tienen 5 hijos, pero sólo viven con uno de ellos, Yaniré (25), su esposo y su pequeño hijo.

Desde hace 8 años Olga se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado. En este negocio le va muy bien,  ya que tiene clientela fija que siempre le piden variedad y lo último de la moda. Su método de venta es al crédito, una vez llegado el plazo de pago, Olga visita a sus clientes en sus casas o trabajos. Por esta actividad obtiene las ganancias que le permiten ayudar en los gastos de su hogar. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca a nivel internacional, por los que también obtiene buenos dividendos.
Para el futuro tiene pensado instalar una tienda de ropa en un local estable para vender más tranquila y en un solo lugar; a su vez, desea descansar de tantas caminatas durante tantos años de su vida.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que será responsable y puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas. Olga tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en mercadería (ropa), ya que tiene muchos pedidos para el verano. También mandará construir el piso de su casa, que es donde ofrece su mercadería y quiere que proyecte una mejor imagen.
texts.en:
Olga, 58, lives in her own home with her life partner Máximo, 58. They have 5 children but only their daughter, Yaniré, 25, her husband and small son, live with them. For the past 8 years, Olga has sold clothing and footwear. She does well in this business because she has regular customers that always ask for the latest fashions and for variety. She sells on credit. When payments are due, Olga visits her customers in their homes or at their work. She makes enough profit to be able to help meet household expenses. She also sells beauty products of an internationally-known brand; this also produces good dividends. For the future, Olga plans to set up a clothing store in a stable setting so that she can sell more comfortably in only one place; she would like to rest from the innumerable walks she has undertaken over these years. This is her third loan with MFP and she is sure that she will be responsible and punctual with her payments. Olga plans to invest the money requested in more clothing because she has many orders placed for Summer. She will also have flooring installed in her house, which is where she conducts her sales, so that it will be more presentable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: S. Yvette est née en 1969 et réside à Sedami à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 41 ans.  Yvette est divorcée et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Yvette vit seule avec ses enfants. Yvette a arrêté les classes au cours primaire. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Yvette vend de l’Akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) dans son quartier. Yvette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Yvette exerce cette activité depuis 20 ans.  Yvette a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Yvette sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux répondre à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Yvette S. was born in 1969 and has lived for 41 years in Sedami in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Yvette is divorced and has two children, both of whom are in school. Yvette lives alone with her children. She ended her studies in primary school. To provide for her children, Yvette sells 'akassa' (a local food made from cornstarch) in her district. Yvette gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Yvette has run this business for 20 years, and has already obtained one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. Yvette is seeking a second loan with ALIDÉ to strengthen her business and better respond to the constantly increasing demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford A. is married and has seven dependents. He has a senior high school education. Clifford sells palm oil and nut crackings for the making of palm kennel oil in Elmina. His wife is a petty trader. The loan acquired by Clifford will be used to purchase gas/oil for his mill processor (machine) and palm fruits for making palm oil. Clifford uses his income to take care of his wife and dependents and for the general upkeep of the home. With the new profits from his expanded business, Clifford plans to save money for a good educational foundation for the children.

To prepare his locally made palm oil, Clifford gets his palm nuts from farmers. He washes them and boils them for about forty minutes until they become soft and tender. The cooked fruits are scooped into a big mortar and gently squashed with a pestle to squeeze out the juice covering the pulp while avoiding damaging the nut. Once this is done, the juice is filtered to remove the chaff (which is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires). The juice is boiled again and the fresh oil floats on the contents of the pot. It is scooped into yet another pot and left to cool. Fresh oil from palm fruits is traditionally used in eating roasted yam or plantain in Africa, especially on the farms after a hard day's work.

loans.use: to purchase gas/oil for his mill processor (machine) and palm fruits for making palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es: María Cristina S. D. R. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a una hija D. 22 años D. edad, la cual se dedica a trabajar, así mismo vive junto a un nieto. María se dedica a la venta D. huevos por mayor, contando con muchos clientes fijos, los cuales a diario compran su producto, razón por la que María lo considera como un negocio muy rentable el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para sostener su hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. huevos, los cuales son muy bien vendidos en el lugar, ya que donD. María habita es una D. las ciudades más comerciales del departamento D. San Salvador, siendo apto par casi todo tipo D. negocio. María desea poder mejorar la estabilidad D. su negocio y D. esta manera la estabilidad D. su casa.
texts.en:
María Cristina S. D. R. is 55 years old and lives in the municipality of Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 22 year old daughter, who is employed, and a grandson. María sells eggs in bulk and has many loyal customers who buy eggs from her on a daily basis. Because of this, Maria considers it to be a very profitable business that provides her with all the money she needs to maintain her home. Maria is applying for a loan with Intergral to purchase larger quantities of eggs which sell very well in her city, one of the most commercially active in the San Salvador department and suitable for almost any type of business. María hopes to improve the stability of her business and in doing so, the stability of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs in bulk

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua F. sells fresh garden eggs (small eggplants), tomatoes and other foodstuffs at Abura.  Efua has received senior high education.  She is married to a farmer. Efua has been selling garden eggs and fresh tomatoes for about a year now. She helps her husband in paying for their rent and other expenditures that may occur. Her loan will be added to her capital to buy more garden eggs, tomatoes and other vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy more garden eggs, tomatoes and other vegetables for sale

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha L., 40 (pictured here), and her husband, Mr. Vy Ngoun, 47, have been married for 18 years and have six children: four sons and two daughters. One daughter is a garment factory worker and the other children are in school. The family lives aL. National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Chantha has been selling corn for five years, while her husband has been a construction worker for four years. Besides the businesses, the couple also grow rice on their farmland in the village. 

Chantha is applying for her first loan in the amount of $650 to purchase a motorized hand tiller to use on her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bolster her working capital and purchase products

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng L. is one of many Cambodian people who earn a living by planting crops. She is 58 years old and is the mother of four children, all of whom have already married and started new homes. She has a life partner in her husband who owns a machine that he uses to plow the neighbor’s land for fees. 

The coming rainfall season allows for growing but Seng L. does not have money to buy any supplies to use on her field. Thus, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to begin growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old and he is still single.  Samuel owns a motorcycle, which he uses to earn his daily living.  Samuel has been driving a motorcycle for about 6 years and he drives from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day.

Samuel needs to purchase a second motorcycle, which he hopes will increase his daily profits.  To end this, Samuel is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this second motorcycle, Samuel hopes to earn a lot of money, which will be used to create other sources of income.

loans.use: One additional motorcycle

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama T. D. is a divorced woman with five children, one girl and four boys. Three of her children attend school, while the last-born is still too young for school. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Dama has sold fried fish to her neighbors, both door-to-door and also from home. She has no other source of income. Dama faces the major challenge of transportation and seasonality, moving from door-to-door during rainy seasons. She decided to work with Yehu because of its sustainable financial services to socio-economically marginalized rural entrepreneurs. 

With this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh), Dama wants to purchase fresh water fish and of 50kgs of cooking oil. In the future, she hopes to build a permanent fish shop.

loans.use: To purchase fresh water fish and 50kgs of cooking oil.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 32 years old. Nemia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Nemia owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nemia is working hard because she wants to give the best to her family. She says she wants to be able to sustain her children's education.

Nemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nemia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nemia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Raul Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento del Cusco.

El  socio es el Sr. Raul; el socio tiene 22 años de edad y El socio es conviviente;  El socio se  dedica a vender materiales de construcción (piedras extraídas de las canteras) El socio trabaja en este negocios desde hace 2 años. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar su capital y poder adquirir materiales.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado  y de este modo se compromete en cumplir con las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. He lives in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. His name is Raul; he is 22 years old and has a live-in partner. His work is selling construction materials (stones extracted from quarries). He has worked in this field for the past 2 years. He is requesting a loan to increase his capital so that he can buy materials. The borrower values and appreciates the loan offered to him, and in accordance with this, he is committed to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his capital so that he can buy materials

loans.name: Jacklina

texts.en: Jacklina T. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, pineapples, jack fruit, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish, tomatoes and yams to sell.  Jacklina is 21 years old and is married to a husband who is a sub county administrator. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock dried fish, tomatoes and yams to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia S. is from  Prenza, Tangub City. She is 29 years old. Antonia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Antonia owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Antonia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Antonia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used belts

loans.name: Huyen Thi Duong's Group

texts.en:
Huyen T. D. is 32 years old with three children. One of them works in an industrial park. She is a farmer. Focusing on growing clean vegetables and selling them to supermarkets since 2005, she earns a stable income to support her family.

As a client since 2004, she has used her loans very effectively in business. Currently, she would like a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy more kinds of high-yielding baby vegetables to grow as a winter crop.

About the Other Borrowers:

1) Hue T. T. is 56 years old with three children who are married. As a farmer she grows flowers in a paddy of 1,440 square meters. She would like a loan of 3,760,000 VND to buy fertilizer. 2) Tuong T. M. H. is 48 years old with two children who are in high school. She is a farmer who grows flowers to sell at retail. She would like a loan of 1,962,000 VND to buy seed for the next season.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of high-yielding baby vegetables

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María F. es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 19 años y  está cursando el 1° año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción Filial Caaguazú.
Su padre presta servicios de seguridad privada en la ciudad.
María actualmente trabaja como Secretaria Administrativa de un Estudio Contable, donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencias al mismo y al tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y abrir su propio estudio contable, para crecer profesionalmente y ser util a la sociedad, lo cual implica mucho esfuerzo, ella está conciente y convencida a enfrentar dicho desafio.
La clienta solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad,  ya que lleva 1 carrera que tiene mucho costo.
 María F. agradece este préstamo ya que servirá de mucha ayuda para su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Maria F. is from the city of Caaguazu, she is 19 years old, and is currently studying her 1st year of accounting at the National University of Asuncion Filial Caaguazu.  Her father offers private security services in the city.  Maria actually works as an administrative secretary at an accounting office where she is gaining experience and obtaining income for her studies at the same time.
She wishes to finish her studies and open her own accounting office in order to grow professionally and be useful to society, which implies a lot of effort; she is conscious of it and convinced she will face the challenge.

She is enrolled in a costly career and solicits the loan to pay for the monthly fees.  Maria F. is thankful for the loan since it will help her studies greatly and at the same time establish credit worthiness which will be important to solidify her future projects.

loans.use: 3 months of school payments

loans.name: Angela Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Angela, ella tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tuvo 4 hijos ya todos mayores de edad. El marido es comerciante. Ella esta en el Banco Comunal hace  ocho años,  está muy contenta y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe por parte de la Fundación  Espoir.

Es un ama de casa que junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de producción y venta de helados. Trabajan todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 17h00. Ella fabrica los helados de distintos sabores que luego su esposo sale a vender en un carro  que tienen, por la localidad y por los campos, ella también vende sus ricos helados en su casa. Además también en las tardes prepara meriendas que vende en su casa hasta las 20h00. Nos cuenta que llevan en este negocio ya 20 años y que a pesar de la competencia les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar los productos que utilizan en la preparación de los deliciosos helados. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
The members of the cooperative bank Mujeres Organizadas (“Organized Women”) meet every fifteen days in the zone of Rocafuerte.  This place is known for its delicious sweets, which are made by area residents and recognized throughout the country.

We meet Angela here, who is 55 years old, married, and has 4 grown children.  Her husband is a merchant.  She has been with the cooperative bank for eight years, and is very content and happy for the help she receives from Fundación Espoir.

She is a homemaker who, with her husband, has a business making and selling ice cream.  They work every day from 7 am to 5 pm.  She makes ice cream of a variety of flavors, and then her husband uses their vehicle to travel around selling their products throughout the locality and countryside.  She also sells her delicious ice creams from her house.  In addition, she prepares snacks in the afternoons, which she sells from her house until 8 pm.  She tells us she’s been in business for 20 years and that, despite competition, things are going well for her.

This loan is for the purchase of ingredients she uses to make her ice creams.  Her dreams are to continue working and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making ice cream, such as fruits, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr: Kavira  M.  est  présidente du groupe Tuchukuliane, âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 11 enfants dont l’un fut décédé. Tous ses enfants étudient. Son mari est  enseignant.  Elle vend l’huile de palme. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre, plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ vers les années 2002, après éruption du volcan Nyiragongo. Elle installe ses produits  au le marché. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec 10 bidons d’huile de palme. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire une belle maison. La cliente Kavira  M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Tuchukuliane est  composé de 15 membres.
texts.en: Kavira M. is president of the Tuchukuliane group. She is 46 years old, married and mother to eleven children, one of whom is dead. All her other children are studying. Her husband is a teacher. She sells palm oil. She began her business with her own money and later on, around 2002 and after the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano, she benefited from a loan of $50 from IMF Hekima. She sells her products at the market. This new loan will allow her to stock up with ten containers of palm oil. Her ambition is to buy a piece of land and build a beautiful house. This customer, Kavira M., thanks Hekima for its actions in favour of the poor, who have no access to classic banks. It should be noted that the Tuchukuliane group is made up of 15 members.

loans.use: Ten containers of palm oil

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en:
Otgonsuren B. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent.  Both of her sons attend a local school. 

Otgonsuren and her husband operate a meat trading business in their town.  They started their meat trading business in 2006 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Since 2010, they have been operating their business in Hovd, where it has proven to be a very profitable place to run the business. They sell 2-3 pieces of livestock in per day to their sister's cafe. They have built a stable and successful operation and their earnings have enabled them to buy a car for their business. 

Since operating the business, Otgonsuren has been able to improve her family's standard of living by purchasing many assets for her family. She is a very clever and business minded woman. She needs more funds to buy a large amount of livestock before the price for such products rise. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more livestock to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana Ekua T. is married and has two children. Her husband is a chain saw operator.  She has been through senior high school.  Nana cooks banku to sell. She also sells gari, canned tomatoes, groundnuts and sugar at Abura. Nana assists her husband with the basic needs of the family. Nana will use the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell and other ingredients to cook banku to sell to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fambul Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in the village of Yele, in northern Sierra Leone, twenty-seven years ago. She is married to a motor-bike taxi driver and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. For four years now, she has been selling gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), rice, pants, shirts, etc. 

This is first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buy gari, rice, pants, shirts, etc., at wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Kantati Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Kantati esta conformado por nueve personas la mayoría de las señoras viven el zona tres de mayo y se dedican a la artesanía de zapatos y también un porcentaje tiene su tienda de barrio ya que viven por la misma zona y el cual se conocen muy bien en el grupo también están dos varones. El presidente es el Sr. Víctor es chofer asalariado en la una empresa muy conocida de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a domingo es casado tiene cincuenta seis años es una persona responsable y dinámica  conoce al grupo por eso lo eligieron presidente, con el dinero del crédito realizara el mantenimiento de su vehículo, la  secretaria es la Sra.  Zulma vive  es casada se dedica ala costura de zapatos  su taller es en su mismo domicilio  es una socia que descanso un ciclo y decidió volver al grupo, con el dinero del crédito comprara cuero para la realización de zapatos. También es un grupo antiguo esta en su noveno ciclo y están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kantati is made of nine members. Most of the women are shoe makers that live in the May 3rd district, but a certain percentage of the members have neighborhood grocery stores since they live in the same area.   There are also two men in the group.

The president is Señor Víctor.  He is 56 years old, married and is a responsible, dynamic person  .His group knows this about him and that is why they elected him president.   He works seven days a week as a salaried driver for a well-known company in the city.  He will use the money from the loan to maintain his vehicle.

The secretary is Señora Zulma.  She is married and crafts shoes for a living from a shop in her home.  She sat out for one loan cycle and decided to rejoin the group.   She will use the money from the loan to buy leather for shoemaking.  

This group has been around for a while and is in its ninth loan cycle.  They are grateful to the institution for the support they provide.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and to purchase leather for shoemaking

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian O. is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Fabian has a boutique, which he has run for five years. He also has a second business – a mobile business selling rope.
To help expand his business, Fabian has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Fabian hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to build a residential house for his family to move into in order to reduce the expense of renting and add money into his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Faithful Women Group

texts.en:
Jenneh K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Faithful Women. She is 51 years old, married, and has eight children who are between the ages of 16 and 34 years. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

For four years, she has been selling pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc., in the New Georgia Junction Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 25,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more pepper, palm oil, rice, salt etc.
 
She describes herself as a determined woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more pepper, palm oil, rice, salt, etc.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members, each of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Touch was chosen by the members T. be the group's leader.

Touch, who was born in 1977, earns her living by vending soup and balut eggs in the local village. In order T. increase income T. improve the family’s condition, she is requesting a loan T. buy more soup supplies and more balut eggs T. support and enlarge her business activities. Her husband, born in 1975, works as a construction worker and is able T. earn a small salaR. T. support the family. This couple has three children who attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy more soup supplies and more balut eggs to support and enlarge her business activities.

loans.name: Hajaratu

texts.en:
This is 38 year old Hajaratu. She is married, and has 2 children aged 28 and 24 years. She has 3 additional dependents. In 2009, Hajaratu established her restaurant business. She began her business because she wants to generate enough to allow her family to live an average life in society. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more drinks and other food items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks and other food items.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom A. N. is 39 years old, married, and has four children.  He is able to take care of his family with the income he earns from running a photocopy business, which he has been doing for 10 ten years.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has managed to boost his business because he can easily access financial resources.  He hopes to own a media company in five years.  He is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES to buy a laptop and a camera.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and a camera

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S. is a bean juice seller in the rural area of Phnom Pech city. He and his wife always get up early in the morning in order to take part of their bean crop to grind to get fresh bean juice to sell at the marketplace. They can earn around $5 in profit for their juice sales business. 

They have been married for years and are blessed with only one child who lives under their roof. This family has a problem with living conditions as they want to move their house onto a bigger plot of land which they bought previously. This is the reason why San S. would like to request a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for moving their house onto a bigger plot of land which they bought previously.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing hamburgers and "salchipapas".

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is 60 years old and married with twelve children between the ages of 17 and 40.  Four of his children are currently in school.  Alphonce has a farm in Kitale in western Kenya that produces maize, bananas and millet that are all sold locally.  He has been in the farming business for the last forty years and employs one farmhand. He also earns income from his tailoring shop in the same location.

Alphonce requests an 80,000 Kes loan from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry business.  He will use the loan to purchase more chicken stock and poultry feed. The extra income from this loan will enable him to educate his children and improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of diseases and poor market prices for his products. He hopes to have expanded his farm to seven acres with five dairy cows and an established poultry farm in the near future.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project by purchasing more chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem, 61, is a low-income person who has been working in the farming business for many years in the province of Kompong Cham. She is married to 69-year-old Mr. Chea, who used to work as a primary teacher in his village. The couple is blessed with two children who have been working in different careers to earn profit. The family's house is getting old and really needs repair but the family currently doesn't have enough savings to do so. Mrs. Khoem is asking for a Kiva loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Karina Rocío

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karina, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  9, 6 y 1 años  de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero trabaja en una fábrica en Montecristi.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para generar sus propios ingresos hace 15 años se dedica a la artesanía, ella fabrica botones de tagua, para lo cual  tiene un torno (máquina para cortar tagua) con la que se elaboran los botones pero en forma cruda, estos productos entregan en Manta a comerciantes al por mayor para que estos los envíen al extranjero para que sean terminados. Trabaja todos los días de la semana con la ayuda de su hermana desde las  08h00 hasta las 12h00 y de 14h00 a 17h00, comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo, su casa y el cuidado de sus pequeños hijos. 

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar tagua que es la  materia prima para la fabricación de los botones. Está en el Banco desde el principio, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener una fábrica grande con mayor tecnología.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Virgen del Rosario" meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for the crafts that are renown nationally and internationally.  Most of the inhabitants here make "tagua" buttons, crafts and are involved in general commerce.

Here we meet Mrs. Karina, age 28, who is married and has three children, ages 9, 6 and 1.  The two oldest are in school.  Her husband works in a factory in Montecristi.

She is a good homemaker and has been generating an income for the last 15 years making crafts.  She makes "tagua" (vegetable ivory) buttons and uses a lathe to cut the buttons in raw form.  She delivers these products to wholesale dealers in Manta who send them overseas to be finished.  She works every day of the week from 8:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. and from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m., with the help of her sister.  She divides her time between her job, the home and caring for her children.

She plans to use the loan to buy tagua which is the raw material for the buttons.  She has been in the bank since its inception and is also its president.  She enjoys the good loan terms.

Her dream is have a large factory with better technology.

loans.use: To buy "tagua" (vegetable ivory).

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly de 46 años vive en el municipio de Soledad  con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 25 años, con ellos tiene sus más grande  sueño  de verlos triunfantes. Nelly confecciona prendas de vestir y también tiene un almacén de ventas de artículos para modistería.  Su negocio funciona en un local ubicado en el centro de Soledad y cuenta con 4 máquinas de coser y 5 vitrinas para exhibir los productos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe Nelly de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el comprará  materia prima e insumos y una máquina de coser industrial. Su margen de contribución es del 31% y maneja una utilidad neta que le permite cubrir su crédito. La mayor parte de sus gastos son operativos.  Sus compras la realiza de contado  y su rotación de inventarios en el negocio de la confección es de 32 días, mientras  a ella le pagan  los créditos que ofrece a los 15 días. El negocio presenta buena rentabilidad sobre las ventas representada en un porcentaje  no menor de un 16%. Su sueño es ampliar su confección y así mismo hacer adecuaciones al almacén donde comercializa los productos de modistería.
texts.en:
Nelly, 46, lives in the town of Soledad with her spouse and two children who are 21 and 25 years of age.  Her great dream about them is seeing them triumph.  Nelly is a dressmaker and also sells dressmaking supplies.  Her business operates in a locale in downtown Soledad and has four sewing machines and five display cases to exhibit the products.  Her Kiva loan is the first loan Nelly’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy raw materials, supplies and an industrial sewing machine. 

Her gross profit is 31% and her net profits are sufficient to repay the loan.  Most of her expenses are operational.  She pays cash for her purchases and inventory turns over in 32 days while she gets the credit she offers repaid in 15 days.  The business is showing profits over sales no less than 16%.  Her dream is to expand the dressmaking as well as to make adjustments to the store where she sells her items.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Nancy Rosalin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Rosalyn; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cerveza, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta cerveza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cajas de cerveza al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Señora Nancy Rosalyn is a member of the communal bank "Mama Simona". The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  


She is 29 years old, married and has 3 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling beer.  She works from 9:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Through this business she has been able to provide for her children.  She wants to expand her beer sales so she is requesting a loan to buy cases of beer wholesale.  

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase cases of beer wholesale.

loans.name: Sayinzoga

texts.en:
Sayinzoga is 37 years old and is married with two children aged 4 and 6 years old.   He has been selling second-hand clothing for one year. His business is well-organized and he works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday.  

Sayinzoga has requested a loan in order to expand his business by purchasing more second hand clothes to sell. With any profits, he plans to reinvest in his business, to save for his future and he hopes he will be able to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 52 years old and lives in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena. She is married with four children.

Charita has a pig raising business and earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her piglets.

Charita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Charita hopes to have savings from her business for her student allowance.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for her pigs

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR PASION ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Elizabeth; tiene 39 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 17, 10, 7 años de edad, la socia trabaja en la compra y venta de maíz blanco, la socia se dedica también a la agricultura, la socia ahora desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas, de maíz blanco para la siembra y también desea remover el terreno de cultivo y luego de la siembra abonar. La socia desea el crédito para poder comprar semillas de maíz blanco, pagar el tractor y comprar abono para la nueva siembra.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SEÑOR PASION ” communal bank, located in the Yucay district, in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Elizabeth: She is 39, married, and has 3 children ages 17, 10 and 7. She works buying and selling white corn. She also works in agriculture. She now wants this loan to invest in the purchase of white corn seeds for sowing, and she also wants to till her land for cultivation and, after sowing, to fertilize. She wants this loan in order to be able to buy white corn seeds, pay for the tractor, and purchase fertilizer for the new crops.

The member is grateful for the support that we are offering and she promises to repay the quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy white corn seeds, pay for a tractor and purchase fertilizer for the new crops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yarn for making jackets.

loans.name: Marinnette

texts.en:
Marinnette is 28 years old and still single. She has a store where she sells basic household goods. According to her, she has acquired many customers because she always has what people need. Aside from groceries, she also offer load (cell phone minutes) for different networks. She has been managing her store for one year as of now.

Marinnette is a hard-working woman of full goals and ideas to improve her business. One of her goals is to see her business grow, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 to purchase groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits for her retail shop business. She is confident that her hard work will allow her to give her family better living conditions where she could provide all the needs of her family and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as cooking oil, ingredients, canned goods, soft drinks and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is aged 28 and married, with 3 children between 2 and 7 years old.  She has been in farming in her home area of Kitale for 3 years. Her farm produces milk, maize and beans for the local market. She works as a tailor for additional income.

Everlyne has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is her first loan request from Juhudi Kilmo. She says she is looking forward to a good relationship with the organization and to repaying the loan on time. She adds that milk production will improve her income and make life better for her family.

She laments of fluctuating milk prices and rampant animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: José, Continua en su taller de carpinteria, en esta ocacion solicita un prestamo para comprar madera de credo, pino y aceituno, este es su principal material para realizar su trabajo, confeccionando muebles para los clientes. Jose ha logrado mantenerse en sus actividades por la ayuda del prestamo anterior, ya que los materiales que compro le sirvieron para ejecutar trabajos,él espera que con la compra mejore la capacidad de respuesta a los clientes en los muebles que deseen y continuar trabajando de la misma manera en los prestamos.
texts.en: Jose continues to have his carpentry shop. At this time he requests a loan to purchase cedar, pine, and olive wood. These are the primary materials that he uses in his work, building furniture for his clients. Jose has managed to keep up his activities thanks to the previous loan. The materials which he purchased helped him to carry out project. He hopes that with this purchase he will be able to improve his ability to respond to his clients, in giving them the furniture which they require. He hopes to continue his work with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase cedar, pine, and olive lumber.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 30-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He has owned a car repair shop since 2009. having already had 15 years of previous experience in this occupation. Mahmoud specializes in changing cars' oil and batteries. He also provides car wash services. Mahmoud is now asking to borrow $1,500 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase oil and batteries. He says that these purchases will help him better serve his customers. His income is needed to help support his wife and two children.

loans.use: to purchase oil and batteries

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, él vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 12 años de edad, Carlos se dedica al negocio desde hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para tener disponibilidad económica, porque su negocio trata de salir por varios pueblos de la zona para comprar en los hogares hierro, cobre, latas, y todo tipo de chatarra, para luego venderla a los lugares donde las recolectan, este préstamo le ayudara para tener dinero disponible para comprar y realizar sus ventas normales.
La aspiración de Carlos es tener disponibilidad económica, para poder darle continuidad al negocio y aumentar los ingresos al hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos has a business buying and selling scrap metal.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 5 and 12.  Carlos has had this business for 5 years.  He works every day from 6am to 4pm.  

He is requesting this loan to have available cash, because his business involves traveling to various towns in the area to purchase iron, copper, cans, and all types of scrap metal at people's homes, and then selling it at recycling centers.  This loan will help him have available cash to make his normal purchases and sales.   

Carlos aspires to have available funds to be able to continue with his business and increase his household income.

loans.use: to purchase iron, copper, cans, and scrap metal.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 67 years old, married to Jane, and they have four school-going children. He does masonry work which has been in operation for the last 24 years, with a monthly income of about KES 30,000.  

He has a good history with KADET LTD, and he is applying for his seventh loan of KES 50,000 after repaying the previous loans successfully. He hopes to use the amount to purchase iron sheets for renovating his rental houses.

The anticipated profits he will save and pay school fees for his children. In future he hopes to grow his business, purchase a plot and build more rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets for renovation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy 200 chicks for her poultry business and three 50 kg sacks of matemba to sell.

loans.name: Sisimukha Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sisimukha Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Sisimukha group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela  takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Pamela will educate her children and repay her loan.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en:
Apaula is 58 years of age and is married, with four children.
Apaula owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has two years' experience in this business.    Apaula needs a loan of WST 1500 to to pay for  box of noodles,soft drinks,cigarette, lollies, snacks , can fish and mutton flaps. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300 or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Apaula joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Apaula 's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to pay for  box of noodles,soft drinks,cigarette, lollies, snacks , can fish and mutton flaps

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda  is a 33-year-old retail shop owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is single and a mother of one child.
Emelda has been running retail shop for the last two years and she is doing great. She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET and this is her second loan to finance her business. She plans to purchase stocks of rice, cooking oil, maize flour and washing powder for her shop. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her child. 
Emelda hopes to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice, cooking oil, maize flour and washing powder.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Wilma is married and has five school-aged children.
