This is his first loan through CEPRODEL.  He is grateful for the opportunity the loan will give him to improve his home and help his family.

loans.use: For home improvement

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un B., age 37, is a fish vendor. She sells small quantities of fish in and around the province of Kompong Tom province. This is a business she has operated for more than ten years. Un B. buys her fish from a wholesale supplier. She usually earns a profit of approximately $1.30 per day to help support her family’s expenses. The family has another financial source in her husband, who works in the farming business. 

Un B. currently uses an old motorcycle for collecting her fish from the supplier, but it is in disrepair and presently inoperable. She has spent considerable amounts of money on repairs. In order to deal with this problem, Un B. is asking for a loan from Kiva to buy a used motorcycle to replacing the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to replace the broken one that she used to use for transporting her fish from the supplier

loans.name: Everlyne Vugudza

texts.en:
Everlyne L. is a 28-year-old enterprising lady from the county of Kakamega in western Kenya. She is single and supports only herself at the moment. 

She is a hardworking business lady who buys and supplies Irish potatoes in Kakamega town. She has been doing this business for the last two years and she makes a monthly income of approximately $240. 

Everlyne is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy thirty bags of potatoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business. Her hope and dream is to become a major distributor of Irish potatoes to higher institutions of learning and to hotels.

loans.use: To buy 30 bags of Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Shanti nagar for the past twenty-four years. She is 44 years of age and has three children, two daughters and a son. Her son left his education after intermediate level and started working to financially contribute to the family. Her daughters are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Gloria shares the financial burden with her husband by doing sewing work. She is very skillful in her work and receives regular orders every month. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her sewing business. She will use the loan in buying a new sewing machine that will help her complete her work more quickly and make more income. She has been doing this business for the past five years and is hopeful that an investment will bring more money and she will be able to provide better living facilities to her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Gloria.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña María Luisa, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con su esposo solamente porque sus hijos tienen sus respectivos hogares, ella tiene 64 años D. edad, viven en casa propia y junto a su pareja realizan las labores D. la ganadería, crían ganado vacuno para la venta D. leche y crías, además destazan reces para vender una vez por semana, también venD. ropa.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ganado D. repasto, esta compra será oportuna porque los animales tienen dos años D. edad, lo que significa que su carne es suave para el destazo.
El objetivo D. doña María Luisa es mantenerse con estabilidad laboral y que con su familia hagan crecer el negocio y mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa lives in a house that she owns in San Miguel with just her husband, as her children have their own homes. She is 64 years old and together with her husband, they work in cattle farming. They raise cattle to sell their milk and calves and they also butcher beef to sell once a week. She also sells clothing.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of beef cattle. This purchase is timely because the animals are two years old, which means that their meat is good for butchering. Maria Luisa’s goal is to have job stability and to work with her family so that the business grows and generates more income.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal ”SOL RADIANTE”, está iniciando su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Los Andes.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de ocho  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Roxana. 

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: costura de deportivos, cafetería, venta de salchipapas, punto de cabinas, artesanías, confección de deportivos, costura de blusas, venta de refrescos.
 
La presidenta, la señora Roxana es una mujer joven de  23 años es soltera. Esta es su primera ves que participa en asociaciones comunales. 

En la actualidad vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa todos los días, con el crèdito que sacara comprara por mayor su mercadería (verdura para la elaboración de las salchipapas)

Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella respondió que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The ”SOL RADIANTE” communal association is beginning its first cycle with the Los Andes office and is made up of eight women.  The advisory council has Roxana as its president.  The members are involved in different businesses, including making sports gear, cafeteria sales, salchipapa sales, cabins, crafts, blouse making, and soft drink sales.

Roxana is 23 years old and this is the first time that she has participated in a communal association.

She sells salchipapas out of her home every day and will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients (vegetables) in quantity.  When asked what she liked best about Pro Mujer (Professional Woman), she said "everything."

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Chap

texts.en:
Chap S. is 61 years old and a married woman who is a local cultivator in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh city. Chap S. currently generates an income of approximately $4 per day from her farming business. Chap S. is married to 62-year-old, Choun Chenda, who is a professional teacher. The couple is blessed with four married kids and two are working at different jobs to earn a daily income. 

Chap S. will take out her first loan to purchase a machine that she can use to pump water for her crops.

loans.use: to purchase a pump.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from the village of Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lorna raises hogs.

Lorna has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase more feed for her hogs. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Mamlakatkhon's Group

texts.en:
Mamlakatkhon is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she has raised a daughter and a son. The son, 26, works in Russia and the daughter, 16, studies at school. Malakatkhon works as a librarian at school. At the moment the family keeps three cows, and the profits gained from milk sales help the family meet their daily needs. Selling the dairy products, the family makes an additional $55 per month. Mamlakatkhon applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a calf in order to increase the number of cattle stock. In autumn she plans to celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam  is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Le Xa village, Mai Hien commune, Dong Anh district. She and her husband are farmers. Her family has a monthly income of 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2009 and repaid her loans punctually. In this loan cycle, she is requesting a loan for  8,502,000 VND to invest in livestock.

loans.use: to invest in livestock.

loans.name: Bertha Piedad

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció y la dejo sola con sus seis hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa.
 
Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que busco la forma de sacar adelante a sus hijos,  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja los tres últimos días de la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y nos cuenta que la mayor parte de sus ventas las hace bajo pedido, en estos tres días  ella  realiza las ventas, entrega los pedidos y cobra ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Compra su mercadería  en Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más variedad de productos. Lleva tres años en este negocio, antes se dedicaba a otra actividad pero no le fue tan bien como con el negocio de ropa.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en comprar jean de mujeres y hombres, camisetas y blusas ya que tiene muchos encargos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por las reuniones educativas ya que aprende mucho.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener un almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
The Virgen Del Rosario Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Colorado in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture.  It is also known for its handicrafts, which are recognized on a national and international level.  Most of the inhabitants here devote themselves to making buttons out of “tagua” (Tagua has been called 'vegetable ivory' because the hard tagua nut has a white endosperm similar to elephant ivory), handicrafts, and general commerce.

This is where we meet Bertha, age 65.  Several years ago her beloved husband died.  His death left her alone with their six children.  Now they are adults, and the youngest still lives in her house.

She is a very good housewife who searched for the way to get her children ahead.  She sells all types of clothes.  She works the last three days of the week, and she sells door to door.  She tells us that the majority of her sales are done through orders.  On these three days she makes sales, delivers orders, and collects because she extends credit.  She collects every two weeks.  

She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil because that is where she gets a greater variety of products.  She has had this business for three years.  Before that she had another business activity, but it did not go as well for her as her clothing business.

She will use this loan to buy women’s and men’s jeans, t-shirts, and blouses because she has a lot of orders.  She has been in the communal bank from its inception.  She likes the educational meetings because she learns a lot.

Her goals are to get ahead in her business and to have a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men’s jeans, t-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Yeral

texts.en:
Yeral was born to be a businessman. “It’s in my blood,” he says. Growing up in Chimbote, Peru, his interest in business was piqued early by watching his parents. His father worked at a local restaurant while his mother sold vegetables and fruits. Oftentimes, he would join his mother on these pursuits and learned the tricks of the trade from her.

His parents’ tremendous influence stayed with him as he moved from Peru to San Francisco in 2004. While working a series of miscellaneous jobs, Yeral’s desire to open up his own business grew. However, as a recent immigrant, he didn’t know how to get things started.

In 2010, his drive to become an entrepreneur propelled him to get into business the way he knew best:  Yeral began serving delicious Peruvian treats at food festivals.  In order to secure a spot at a Peruvian Food Festival, he needed a loan to pay the initial fee but when he turned to a major bank, he was refused credit because he did not have tax returns, a business license or a business bank account. 

Without a set destination, he marched through San Francisco’s Mission district, adamant that somewhere in the sea of pay-day loans and pawn shops, he would find a financial institution that would help him.  At last, he stumbled upon Opportunity Fund, where the staff recognized his potential and his passion.  Yeral got the cash he needed to capitalize his business, as well as a foothold into the mainstream American financial system.

At last year’s Peruvian Food Festival, Yeral sold over 400 plates of food and gained recognition for his talent making tasty Peruvian treats.  He wants to return again this year, and this time he expects to sell closer to 800 plates of food, doubling his business over last year. Yeral needs a second loan for $4,000 in order to buy more inventory and secure his spot at this year’s Peruvian Food Festival, which will be held in July.  

Currently, Yeral devotes 50% of his time to expanding his business and he spends the other 50% working at a bar. He aims to expand his business so that one day he can devote 100% of his energy to serving delicious Peruvian treats.

loans.use: to buy more inventory and secure his spot at this year’s Peruvian Food Festival.

loans.name: Racana Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe es casada, tiene 23 años D. edad, curso dos años D. educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales aun no estudian, se dedica a la confección D. blusas, inicia este negocio en la casa D. ella, y hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo  D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar telas para confeccionar blusas, ya que en el futuro espera tener un local propio para venta D. blusas y ropa típica. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, venta D. dulces y gomas D. mascar, venta D. leña y a la venta D. blusas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is married and is 23 years old.  She completed two years of elementary school.  She has 2 children who are not yet in school.  She has a business making blouses, which she started in her house.  She has 10 years of experience in this traD., and she has the support of her husband, who is a merchant.

She decided to organize a group with the objective of requesting a loan.  She will use the loan to buy fabric to make blouses, since in the future she hopes to have her own store where she can sell blouses and traditional Guatemalan clothing.  The other members of the group work in retail traD. selling sweets, chewing gum, firewood and blouses.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is married and her husband operates a construction supplies business. He is very good in his customer dealings and receives a good number of orders every month. 
Nazia is a housewife as well as a working lady. She sells cattle such as sheep and goats. She buys them when they are young and sells them after raising them up. She also operates a thread-making business. She purchases old warm clothes and gets thread out of them to earn extra income for her family. 
Nazia has a daughter who is four years old and has not started her education yet. She has a plan to enroll her daughter in a school next year. 
Nazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for buying sheep and goats for her animal sales business. She has a plan to sell sheep and goats on Eid (a Muslim occasion when people buy animals for slaughtering). She has been operating her business for some time now and hopes that she will make good profits. Nazia is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for animal sales business.

loans.name: Gerandia

texts.en:
Gerandia is a 49-year-old widowed woman. She has 3 adult dependents living with her in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is engaged in banana production to earn a living. Gerandia has been doing this for 15 years. With this kind of work,  she got the chance to send all her children to school. Approximately, she makes PHP 3,000 a month.

Earlier this year, Gerandia joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase young raised banana trees of a different type to plant. She hopes for a good production to gain more income. Gerandia plans to buy a motorcycle to transport goods easily.

loans.use: To purchase young raised banana trees of a different type to plant.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 50 años quien tiene una refresquería y carnicería desde hace 4 años. Ella inicio con la venta de refrescos naturales  y con las ganancias empezó a vender carne.
Ella con el préstamo invertirá en pollo y su meta es comprarse un frízer más grande.
texts.en:
Mrs Leticia is a hard-working and enterprising woman, age 50, who has had a drink store and butcher's shop for 4 years. She started off selling natural drinks, and with her income she started to sell meat.
With this loan, she will invest in chicken. Her goal is to buy herself a larger freezer.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo, de 41 años, es un hombre muy laborioso, vive en su casa propia y se esmera a diario por sobre salir adelante  junto a su esposa e hijos. El trabajo que realiza Pablo es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, esta labor lo realiza junto a su pareja quien también se esmera arduamente en remolcar la tierra. Pablo vio por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene por sus granos. Cuando su trabajo se le acumula no duda en contratar jornaleros para que tenga mayor avance en cuanto a su faena. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad de poder respirar el viento fresco que rodea todo el valle del Río Apurimac. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino de recorrido es muy largo y agotador desde su chacra hasta los tendales ya que es allí donde realiza el secado respectivo de sus productos. Más adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este será su décimo préstamo de Pablo con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causar problemas a la entidad financiera y agradece a los prestatarios por apoyarle en el progreso de su trabajo. Con los 3,000  mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y sacos de abono para mejorar  y aumentar su producción
texts.en:
Pablo, 41, is a very hardworking man. He lives in his own house and does his best daily to get ahead, together with his wife and children. Pablo works the land, where he cultivates cacao, coffee and citrus trees. He labors alongside his partner who also takes great pains to work the soil.

Pablo finds it convenient to take his products to the city of San Francisco since he states it is there where he can obtain the best prices for his crops. When his tasks are overwhelming, he does not hesitate to contract day laborers in order to speed up his work.

What he most likes about his work is that he has the freedom to breathe the fresh air surrounding the valley of Rio Apurimac. He has been doing this work for 15 years and considers his most difficult task that of transporting his products, since the road he has to travel is a very long and exhausting one from his farm to the drying area where his crops are dried. Later he hopes to buy new land in order to increase his production.

This will be Pablo’s tenth loan from MFP. He expects to be very punctual in his payments, since he does not want to cause any problems and is grateful to the lenders for supporting him in his work. With the 3,000 nuevos soles requested, he will buy cacao seeds and sacks of fertilizer in order to improve and increase his production.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is married with four children. He is 36 years old and lives in Esperanza, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. Edwin has been in his business for 7 years. He raises pigs for sale to earn a living. He earns 15,800 Philippine pesos (PHP) with this line of business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase feed for his newborn piglets.

Edwin has been a member of GDMPC for one year. He is hoping to have his own motor cart or motorcycle that he can use to purchase feed and for the delivery of pigs to the buyer.

======================================

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

location.town: ESPERANZA, RAMON MAGSAYSAY, ZAMBOANA DEL SUR

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman. She has three school going children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transportation. 

Asha has operated a weaving business for the past nine years. In addition, she has a motorcycle transport business, which contributes as her other source of income. Her potential clients are the area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her business standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ines Lucila

texts.es:
Inés de  47 años, una mujer muy trabajadora y honrada, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Suburbio”. 
Su negocio es una pequeña tienda ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.  Ya que desde muy pequeña le gustaba el comercio.
Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, inicia de las 6:00am hasta las 23:00pm.
Su dificultad es que le falta mercadería, no tiene muchos suministros necesarias para la venta.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el incremento de su negocio, para la compra de mercadería  como: arroz, aceites, atún, etc. y el mejoramiento de su pequeño local que está ubicado en su vivienda.
Su sueño es que su tienda crezca y así pueda tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Inés is 47 years old. She is a very hardworking and honest woman who lives in a suburb called "Suburbio". She has a small business located in the front part of her house, as since young she has liked business. She works from Monday to Sunday from 6:00am until 23:00pm. Her difficulty is that she doesn't have enough merchadise or supplies necessary to sell. 

She is asking for a loan to grow her business, to buy merchandise such as: rice, oil, tuna, etc., and improve the small locale located in her house. Her dream is that her business grow so that she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, oil, tuna, etc.

loans.name: Nazira's Group

texts.en:
Nazira is the leader of this group. She is 33 and married to a tractor driver. Together with her husband she is bringing up a daughter and a son. The daughter studies at school and the son is still preschool age. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, Nazira started to breed cattle with the help of her husband. In her opinion it is an effective way of investing money. She is applying for this loan because she needs money to purchase more farm animals for breeding, fattening and reselling. In the future Nazira plans to expand a shed to be able to keep more animals.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding, fattening and reselling.

loans.name: Alex Omar

texts.es:
El señor Alex tiene 37 años de edad y vive en la aldea rural de Tapikilares en el municipio de San Francisco Yojoa. Lleva 15 años de casado con su esposa Mirna y la pareja tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 2 años de edad. 

Alex se dedica al cultivo de maíz y actualmente cultiva dos manzanas de tierra. Aprendió el oficio de sus padres, los cuales eran agricultores. Alex se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que fue niño y  continúa esa actividad heredada para mejorar su nivel de vida familiar. Sus hijos también colaboran en las actividades agrícolas cuando no están estudiando. 

Normalmente después de la cosecha, Alex se lleva el maíz al mercado para vender y negociar. Cuando hay abundancia de maíz, los precios bajan. Cuando hay escasez, Alex no tiene que ir al mercado porque los compradores salgan a buscar maíz en comunidades como el suyo. Alex se aprovecha para subir sus precios y así recibe mejores ingresos. 

Alex va a utilizar este crédito de L5000 para invertir en el cultivo. Es el primer crédito que él maneja. El espera continuar la actividad agrícola para terminar de educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alex, age 37, lives in the rural village of Tapikilares in the San Francisco Yojoa municipality.  He has been married to his wife, Mirna, for 15 years.  The couple has three children; ages 15, 13, and 2.

Alex grows corn, and he currently has two “manzanas” (a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters or 1.728 acres) of land.  He learned this trade from his parents, who were farmers.  Alex has devoted himself to farming since he was a boy.  He continues with this business activity that he inherited in order to improve his family’s standard of living.  His children also participate in the farming activities when they are not in school.

After the harvest Alex usually takes the corn to the market to sell and to trade.  When there is an abundance of corn the prices drop.  When there is a scarcity, Alex does not have to go to the market because the buyers come to look for corn in communities like his.  Alex takes advantage of this to raise his prices and get better income.

Alex will use this loan for 5,000 lempiras to invest in farming.  This is the first loan that he has managed.  He hopes to continue with the farming activity in order to finish educating his children.

loans.use: to invest in growing corn.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 51 years old and is married with one child. He lives in Candanay Sur, Siquijor, Siquijor. Virgilio runs an electronics shop and earns 14,000 PHP doing this work. He has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for seven months.

Virgilio is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to purchase assorted accessories for his shop. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase electronic accessories to sell

loans.name: Musalaba F.a Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musalaba F. A. Group in Western Kenya! 

Philisters takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Philisters will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

Philisters is the facilitator of the Musalaba F. A. group. She is pictured with her group members. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Musalaba F.A. group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Philisters and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). Florence has a business of raising chicken.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Florence sells her products from home. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chicks and feeds. The main business challenges for Florence include transportation of chicken feeds and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 1500 chickens and to own a delivery van to ease transportation. Florence lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and feeds

loans.name: Ligia Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Ligia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es desde 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, Cuenca es muy rica en historia, cultura y tradiciones, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Ligia tiene 37 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 6 hijos  de 22, 19, 17, 14, 12 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo es soltero, su segunda hija es casada y viven independientemente, su tercer hijo trabaja, dos de sus hijos están estudiando en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. ligia se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa usada encontrándose en esta actividad hace 13 años, también vende ropa nueva pero solo bajo pedido hace seis meses, su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad en su tiempo libre,. También se dedica a la limpieza de una casa actividad en la que labora medio día.

Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa usada para crecer en su negocio. 

Su meta es llegar a tener su propio capital y no tener que pedir prestado.
texts.en:
Ligia is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras” communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity since 1999.  Cuenca is very rich in history, culture and traditions.  It has a varied cuisine and its residents maintain the culture and tradition of its peoples.

Ligia is 37 years old living in a common law relationship and has 6 children who are 22, 19, 17, 14, 12 and 7 years old.  Her oldest son is single, her next daughter is married and they live independently.  Her third son works, two of her children are attending secondary school and her youngest attends a local little elementary school.  Her husband works as a private employee.  She does not own a house, she rents.

Ligia sells all types of used clothes; she’s been in business 13 years.  She’s also been selling new clothes for the last six months but only on prior order.  She sells her merchandise throughout the city in her free time.  She also works half days cleaning a house.

This is the third loan she’s taken in the communal bank and will use it to buy used clothes to increase her business.  Her goal is to have her own capital and not have to ask for loans.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Herminia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda, tiene 2 hijos, todos ya mayores de edad que trabajan de forma independiente.
Herminia cuenta que tiene una Frutería y Verdulería en el Mercado Municipal de Santaní, gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ya pudo formarse una buena clientela, y como consecuencia un buen ingreso. Ella comenta que se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante y de esa forma tener un poco más de ingresos, para poder tener una vejez sin problemas.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar frutas de estación, como ser melones, sandías, uvas, y demás con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Sra. Herminia is from the city of Santaní. She is 64 years old, widowed, and has two grown children who work independently. She has a fruit and vegetable stand at the municipal market in Santaní. Thanks to the high quality of products that she offers, she has been able to establish a good customer base and earn a good income. She says that she strives to move forward so that she can generate a little more income and have a retirement that is problem-free.

Herminia is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons, watermelons, grapes, and other types of products so that she can restock her inventory and meet the demand of her customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is  a farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya, aged 43 and with 12 years of experience in farming and specifically the dairy, tea and poultry farming business.She is married with two children aged 15 and 6 years and both schooling.

Irene has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to expand her farming business. She has plans to use half of the loan to buy more poultry birds and the other half to buy a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to continue improving her farming so as to make it her core business and meet her family needs from it. She would also like to buy more land for more commercial-based farming.

Irene says the challenge is in their limited parcels of land and poor market prices for farm produce.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edwin Tomas

texts.en:
My name is Edwin and I sell new clothes such as blouses, shirts, boy's clothing,and underclothes. I have been in business for 1 year, whihc is located in Danli. My wife helps me with my business. We are able to grow with the income that we have, however we want to re-construct our house.

Me llamo Edwin y me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, ropa de niño y ropa interior, mi negocio lo tengo desde hace 1 año y esta ubicado en uno de los boulevares de Danli. El negocio es familiar es decir mi esposa me ayuda a vender. Con los ingresos que tenemos de las ventas hemos podido hacer crecer nuestro negocio un poco mas, pero ahora queremos construir nuestra casa, por eso necesitamos invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia para incrementar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, blusas, ropa interior y otros.

loans.name: Galib

texts.en:
Galib lives in Yenikand village, Salyan region  He is 42, married, has 2 children.  
He needs a loan of $1000 to buy a water heater for his hair dressing salon.
Galib has a strong belief that he will get more clients after purchasing all the equipment needed for a modern salon and this will lead to increased income.He has worked in this salon for 4 years.
This business has allowed him to provide a good source of income for his family .
He made an a strong effort to improve his services.
His salon attracts regular clients.

loans.use: To buy a water heater
